Book III of [End of The Chapter

To]478-end of the chapter to [Rudolf]2-rudolf]1-the river john galsworthy book iii of end of the chapter to rudolf and [Viola Sauter]211-viola sauter

Chapter 1

[Clare]302-clare , who for seventeen months had been [the wife of [Sir Gerald Corven]213-jerry of [the Colonial Service]480-the colonial service]479-the wife of sir gerald corven of the colonial service , stood on [the boat deck of [an Orient liner]482-an orient liner in [the River Thames]3-the river thames]481-the boat deck of an orient liner in the river thames , waiting for [it]482-an orient liner to dock . It was ten o clock of a mild day in October , but [she]302-clare wore a thick tweed coat , for the voyage had been hot . [She]302-clare looked pale indeed , a little sallow but [her]302-clare clear brown eyes were fixed eagerly on [the land]483-the land and [her]302-clare slightly touched - up lips were parted , so that [her]302-clare face had the vividness to which it was accustomed . [She]302-clare stood alone , until a voice said : Oh ! HERE [you]302-clare are ! and [a young man]484-a young man , appearing from behind [a boat]485-a boat , stood beside [her]302-clare . Without turning , [she]302-clare said : Absolutely perfect day ! It ought to be lovely at [home]486-home . [I]0-i thought [you]484-a young man d be staying in [Town]4-town for a night at least ; and [we]487-we could have had a dinner and theatre . Won t [you]484-a young man ? [[My]0-i dear young man]488-my dear young man , [I]0-i shall be met . Perfectly damnable , things coming to an end ! Often more damnable , things beginning . [He]484-a young man gave [her]302-clare a long look , and said suddenly : [Clare]302-clare , [you]302-clare realise , of course , that [I]0-i love [you]302-clare ? [She]302-clare nodded . Yes . But [you]484-a young man don t love [me]0-i ? Wholly without prejudice . [I]0-i wish [I]0-i wish [you]484-a young man could catch fire for a moment . [I]0-i am [a respectable married woman]489-a respectable married woman , [Tony]214-tony . Coming back to [England]5-england because Of the climate of [Ceylon]6-ceylon . [He]484-a young man kicked at the rail . Just as it s getting perfect . [I]0-i ve not said anything , but [I]0-i know that [your]484-a young man that [Corven Clare]302-clare lifted [her]302-clare eyebrows , and [he]484-a young man was silent ; then [both]490-both looked at [the shore]491-the shore , becoming momentarily more and more a consideration . When [two young people]492-two young people have been nearly three weeks together on board [a ship]493-a ship , [they]492-two young people do not know [each other]494-each other half so well as [they]492-two young people think [they]492-two young people do . In the abiding inanity of a life when everything has stopped except the engines , the water slipping along [the ship]495-the ship s sides , and the curving of the sun in the sky , [their]492-two young people daily chair - to - chair intimacy gathers a queer momentum and a sort of lazy warmth . [They]492-two young people know that [they]492-two young people are getting talked about , and do not care . After all , [they]492-two young people can not get off [the ship]495-the ship , and there is nothing else to do . [They]492-two young people dance together , and the sway of [the ship]495-the ship , however slight , favours the closeness of [their]492-two young people contacts . After ten days or so [they]492-two young people settle down to a life together , more continuous than that of marriage , except that [they]492-two young people still spend [their]492-two young people nights apart . And then , all of a sudden , [the ship]495-the ship stops , and [they]492-two young people stop , and there is a feeling , at least on one side , perhaps on both , that stocktaking has been left till too late . A hurried vexed excitement , not unpleasurable , because suspended animation is at an end , invades [their]492-two young people faculties ; [they]492-two young people are faced with the real equation of land animals who have been at [sea]499-sea . [Clare]302-clare broke the silence . [You]500-you ve never told [me]0-i why [you]500-you re called [Tony]214-tony when [your]500-you name is [James]216-mr. croom . That IS why . [I]0-i WISH [you]500-you d be serious , [Clare]302-clare ; [we]501-we haven t much time before [the darned ship docks]502-the darned ship docks . [I]0-i simply can t bear the thought of not seeing [you]500-you every day . [Clare]302-clare gave [him]500-you a swift look , and withdrew [her]302-clare eyes to [the shore]491-the shore again . How clean ! [she]302-clare was thinking . [He]500-you had , indeed , a clean oval - shaped brown face , determined , but liable to good humour , with dark grey eyes inclined to narrow with [his]500-you thoughts , and darkish hair ; and [he]500-you was thin and active . [He]500-you took hold of a button of [her]302-clare coat . [You]500-you haven t said a word about [yourself]500-you out there , but [you]500-you aren t happy , [I]0-i know . [I]0-i dislike [people who talk about [their]504-people who talk about their private lives private lives]504-people who talk about their private lives . Look ! [he]500-you put a card into [her]302-clare hand : [That club]505-that club always finds [me]0-i . [She]302-clare read : [MR . JAMES BERNARD CROOM]216-mr. croom , [The Coffee House]506-the coffee house , [St. James Street]27-st. james s street . Isn t [the Coffee House]506-the coffee house very out of date ? Yes , but it s still rather the thing . [[My]0-i Dad]508-my dad put [me]0-i down when [I]0-i was born . [I]0-i have [an uncle]509-an uncle by marriage who belongs [Sir Lawrence Mont]217-sir lawrence , tall and twisty and thin ; [you]510-you ll know [him]509-an uncle by a tortoiseshell - rimmed eyeglass . [I]0-i ll look out for [him]509-an uncle . What are [you]510-you going to do with [yourself]510-you in [England]5-england ? Hunt a job . That s more than [one man]511-one man s work , it seems . What sort of job ? Anything except schoolmastering and selling things on commission . But does [anybody]512-anybody ever get anything else nowadays ? No . It s a bad look - out . What [I]0-i d like would be [an estate agency]513-an estate agency , or something to do with horses . Estates and horses are both dying out . [I]0-i know [one or two racing men]514-one or two racing men rather well . But [I]0-i expect [I]0-i shall end as [a chauffeur]515-a chauffeur . Where are [you]510-you going to stay ? With [[my]0-i people]516-my people . At first , anyway . If [you]510-you still want to see [me]0-i when [you]510-you ve been [home]486-home a week , [Condaford Grange]8-condaford grange , [Oxfordshire]9-oxfordshire , will find [me]0-i . Why did [I]0-i ever meet [you]510-you ? said [the young man]518-the young man , with sudden gloom . Thank [you]510-you . Oh ! [you]510-you know what [I]0-i mean . [God]218-god ! [she]519-she s casting anchor . Here s the tender ! Oh ! [Clare]302-clare ! [Sir]520-sir ? Hasn t it meant anything to [you]520-sir ? [Clare]302-clare looked at [him]520-sir steadily before answering . Yes . But [I]0-i don t know if it will ever mean any more . If it doesn t , thank [you]520-sir for helping [me]0-i over a bad three weeks . [The young man]518-the young man stood silent , as [only those can be silent whose feelings are raging for expression]522-only those can be silent whose feelings are raging for expression . . . . The beginnings and endings of all human undertakings are untidy : the building of [a house]523-a house , the writing of a novel , the demolition of [a bridge]524-a bridge , and , eminently , the finish of a voyage . [Clare]302-clare landed from the tender in the usual hurly - burly , and , still attended by [young Croom]216-mr. croom , came to rest in the arms of [[her]302-clare sister]525-her sister . [Dinny]219-dinny ! How sweet of [you]219-dinny to face [this bally - hooley]526-this bally - hooley ! [[My]0-i sister]527-my sister , [Dinny Cherrell Tony Croom]220-dinny . [I]0-i shall be all right now , [Tony]220-dinny . Go and look after [your]219-dinny own things . [I]0-i ve got [[Fleur]221-fleur s car]528-fleur s car , said [Dinny]220-dinny . What about [your]219-dinny trunks ? [They]529-they re booked through to [Condaford]10-condaford . Then [we]530-we can go straight off . [The young man]518-the young man , going with [them]530-we to [the car]532-the car , said Good - bye with a jauntiness which deceived [no one]533-no one ; and [the car]532-the car slid away from [the dock]535-the dock . Side by side [the sisters]536-the sisters looked at [each other]494-each other , a long and affectionate scrutiny ; and [their]536-the sisters hands lay , squeezed together , on the rug . Well , ducky ! said [Dinny]220-dinny , at last . Lovely to see [you]219-dinny ! Am [I]0-i wrong to read between the lines ? No . [I]0-i m not going back to [him]518-the young man , [Dinny]220-dinny . No , never , non ? No , never , non ! Oh ! dear ! [Poor darling]538-poor darling ! [I]0-i won t go into it , but it became impossible . [Clare]302-clare was silent , then added suddenly , with a toss back of [her]302-clare head : Quite impossible ! Did [he]518-the young man consent to [your]302-clare coming ? [Clare]302-clare shook [her]302-clare head . [I]0-i slipped off . [He]518-the young man was away . [I]0-i wirelessed [him]518-the young man , and wrote from [Suez]222-suez . There was another silence . Then [Dinny]220-dinny squeezed [her]302-clare hand and said : [I]0-i was always afraid of it . The worst of it is [I]0-i haven t a penny . Is there anything in hats now , [Dinny]220-dinny ? All British hats [I]0-i wonder . Or , perhaps , [I]0-i could breed dogs bull terriers ; what d [you]220-dinny think ? [I]0-i don t at present . [We]539-we ll enquire . How are things at [Condaford]10-condaford ? [We]539-we rub on . [Jean]223-jean has gone out to [Hubert]238-hubert again , but [the baby]540-the baby s there just a year old now . [Cuthbert Conway Cherrell]224-cuthbert conway cherrell . [I]0-i suppose [we]539-we shall call [him]224-cuthbert conway cherrell [Cuffs]225-cuffs . [He]224-cuthbert conway cherrell s rather a duck . Thank God [I]0-i haven t that complication ! Certain things have their advantages . [Her]541-her face had the hardness of a face on a coin . Have [you]220-dinny had any word from [him]224-cuthbert conway cherrell ? No , but [I]0-i shall , when [he]224-cuthbert conway cherrell realises that [I]0-i mean it . Was there [another woman]542-another woman ? [Clare]302-clare shrugged . Again [Dinny]220-dinny s hand closed on [hers]302-clare . [I]0-i m not going to make a song of [my]0-i affairs , [Dinny]220-dinny . Is [he]224-cuthbert conway cherrell likely to come [home]486-home about it ? [I]0-i don t know . [I]0-i won t see [him]224-cuthbert conway cherrell if [he]224-cuthbert conway cherrell does . But , [darling]544-darling , [you]544-darling ll be hopelessly hung up . Oh ! don t let s bother about [me]0-i . How have [you]544-darling been ? And [she]302-clare looked critically at [[her]302-clare sister]525-her sister : [You]544-darling look more Botticellian than ever . [I]0-i ve become an adept at skimping . Also , [I]0-i ve gone in for bees . Do [they]546-they pay ? Not at present . But on a ton of honey [we]547-we could make about seventy pounds . How much honey did [you]544-darling have this year ? About two hundredweight . Are there any horses still ? Yes , [we]547-we ve saved the horses , so far . [I]0-i ve got a scheme for [a Condaford Grange bakery]548-a condaford grange bakery . [The home farm]549-the home farm is growing wheat at double what [we]547-we sell it at . [I]0-i want to mill and bake [our]547-we own and supply [the neighbourhood]550-the neighbourhood . [The old mill]551-the old mill could be set going for a few pounds , and there s [a building for [the bakery]553-the bakery]552-a building for the bakery . [It]552-a building for the bakery wants about three hundred to start [it]552-a building for the bakery . [We]547-we ve nearly decided to cut enough timber . [The local traders]554-the local traders will rage furiously . [They]554-the local traders will . Can [it]555-it really pay ? At a ton of wheat to [the acre vide Whitaker]556-the acre vide whitaker [we]547-we reckon [thirty acres of [our]547-we wheat]557-thirty acres of our wheat , plus as much Canadian to make good light bread , would bring [us]547-we in more than eight hundred and fifty pounds , less , say , five hundred , cost of milling and baking . It would mean baking one hundred and sixty two - pound loaves a day and selling about 56,000 loaves a year . [We]547-we should need to supply [eighty households]558-eighty households , but that s only [the village]559-the village , more or less . And [we]547-we d make the best and brightest bread . Three hundred and fifty a year profit , said [Clare]302-clare . [I]0-i wonder . So do [I]0-i , said [Dinny]220-dinny . Experience doesn t tell [me]0-i that every estimate of profit should be halved , because [I]0-i haven t had any , but [I]0-i suspect it . But even half would just tip the beam the right way for [us]547-we , and [we]547-we could extend operations gradually . [We]547-we could plough a lot of grass in time . It s a scheme , said [Clare]302-clare , but would [the village]559-the village back [you]561-you ? So far as [I]0-i ve sounded [them]562-them yes . [You]561-you d want [somebody to run it]563-somebody to run it . M yes . It would have to be someone who didn t mind what [he]563-somebody to run it did . Of course [he]563-somebody to run it d have the future , if it went . [I]0-i wonder , said [Clare]302-clare , again , and wrinkled [her]302-clare brows . Who , asked [Dinny]220-dinny suddenly , was [that young man]564-that young man ? [Tony Croom]220-dinny ? Oh ! [He]564-that young man was on [a tea plantation]565-a tea plantation , but [they]565-a tea plantation closed down . And [she]302-clare looked [[her]302-clare sister]525-her sister full in the face . [Pleasant]226-pleasant ? Yes , rather a dear . [HE]564-that young man wants a job , by the way . So do about [three million others]567-three million others . Including [me]0-i . [You]561-you haven t come back to [a very cheery England]568-a very cheery england , [darling]544-darling . [I]0-i gather [we]570-we fell off the gold standard or something while [I]0-i was in [the Red Sea]12-the red sea . What is the gold standard ? It s what [you]561-you want to be on when [you]561-you re off , and to be off when [you]561-you re on . [I]0-i see . The trouble , apparently , is that [our]570-we exports and carrying - trade profits and interests from investments abroad don t any longer pay for [our]570-we imports ; so [we]570-we re living beyond [our]570-we income . [Michael]227-michael says [anybody]512-anybody could have seen that coming ; but [we]570-we thought it would be all right on the night . And it isn t. Hence [the National Government]13-the national government and the election . Can [they]572-they do anything if [they]572-they remain in ? [Michael]227-michael says yes ; but [he]227-michael s notably hopeful . [Uncle Lawrence]228-uncle lawrence says [they]572-they can put a drag on panic , prevent money going out of [the country]573-the country , keep the pound fairly steady , and stop profiteering ; but that nothing under a wide and definite reconstruction that will take twenty years will do the trick ; and during that time [we]570-we shall all be poorer . Unfortunately no Government , [he]228-uncle lawrence says , can prevent [us]570-we liking play better than work , hoarding to pay these awful taxes , or preferring the present to the future . [He]228-uncle lawrence also says that if [we]570-we think [people]574-people will work as [they]574-people did in the war to save [the country]573-the country , [we]570-we re wrong ; because , instead of being [one people against an outside enemy]576-one people against an outside enemy , [we]570-we re [two peoples against the inside enemy of [ourselves]570-we]577-two peoples against the inside enemy of ourselves , with quite opposite views as to how [our]570-we salvation is to come . Does [he]228-uncle lawrence think [the socialists]578-the socialists have a cure ? The sun , very low , was still shining through an elm tree . There was no wind , and [her]302-clare nerves sucked up repose in that pigeon - haunted stillness , scented so differently from [Ceylon]6-ceylon . Native air , deliciously sane , fresh and homespun , with a faint tang of burning leaves . [She]302-clare could see the threading blue smoke from where [the gardeners]674-the gardeners had lighted a small bonfire in [the orchard]675-the orchard . And almost at once [she]302-clare lit a cigarette . The whole of [Clare]302-clare was in that simple action . [She]302-clare could never quite rest and be still , must always move on to that fuller savouring which for such natures ever recedes . A fantail on the gutter of the sloped stone roof watched [her]302-clare with a soft dark little eye , preening itself slightly . Beautifully white it was , and had a pride of body ; so too had that small round mulberry tree which had dropped a ring of leaves , with their unders uppermost , spangling the grass . The last of the sunlight was stirring in what yellowish - green foliage was left , so that the tree had an enchanted look . Seventeen months since [she]302-clare had stood at this window and looked down over that mulberry tree at [the fields]676-the fields and [the rising coverts]677-the rising coverts ! Seventeen months of foreign skies and trees , foreign scents and sounds and waters . All new and rather exciting , tantalising , unsatisfying . No rest ! Certainly none in [the white house]678-the white house with [the wide verandah [she]302-clare had occupied at [Kandy]19-kandy]679-the wide verandah she had occupied at kandy . [Dinny]261-dinny , dangling a bead chain over [the baby]540-the baby , paid no attention . Never since the summer evening last year , when [she]243-lady mont came back [home]486-home after [Wilfrid]237-wilfrid s flight , had [she]243-lady mont made or suffered any allusion to [her]243-lady mont feelings . [No one]533-no one , perhaps not even [she]243-lady mont [herself]243-lady mont , knew whether [she]243-lady mont was heart - whole once more . It was , indeed , as if [she]243-lady mont had no heart . So long , so earnestly had [she]243-lady mont resisted its aching , that it had slunk away into the shadows of [her]243-lady mont inmost being , where even [she]243-lady mont could hardly feel it beating . What would [you]751-you like to do now , [Auntie]250-auntie ? [He]540-the baby has to go to sleep . Take [me]0-i round [the garden]752-the garden . [They]753-they went down and out on to [the terrace]754-the terrace . Oh ! said [Dinny]261-dinny , with dismay , [Glover]264-glover has gone and beaten the leaves off the little mulberry . [Lady Mont]243-lady mont thrust [her]243-lady mont arm within [[her]243-lady mont niece]711-her niece s. [I]0-i ve often thought , [she]243-lady mont said , that [I]0-i should like to be a goat . Not in [England]5-england , tied to a stake and grazing in a mangy little circle . No , with a bell on [a mountain]761-a mountain . A he - goat , [I]0-i think , so as not to be milked . [Lady Mont]243-lady mont stood , ruefully regarding [her]243-lady mont . And [Dinny]261-dinny , staring at the flowers , said suddenly : [Aunt Em]236-aunt em , somehow there must be a happy ending for [Clare]302-clare . Chapter 4

The custom known as canvassing , more peculiar even than its name , was in full blast round [Condaford]10-condaford . [Every villager]771-every villager had been invited to observe how appropriate it would be if [they]771-every villager voted for [Dornford]235-dornford , and how equally appropriate it would be if [they]771-every villager voted for [Stringer]266-stringer . [They]771-every villager had been exhorted publicly and vociferously , by [ladies]772-ladies in [cars]773-cars , by ladies out of [cars]773-cars , and in the privacy of [[their]771-every villager homes]775-their homes by voices speaking out of trumpets . By newspaper and by leaflet [they]771-every villager had been urged to perceive that [they]771-every villager alone could save [the country]573-the country . [They]771-every villager had been asked to vote early , and only just not asked to vote often . To [their]771-every villager attention had been brought the startling dilemma that whichever way [they]771-every villager voted [the country]573-the country would be saved . [They]771-every villager had been exhorted by [people who knew everything , it seemed , except how it would be saved]778-people who knew everything , it seemed , except how it would be saved . Neither [the candidates]779-the candidates nor [[their]779-the candidates ladies]780-their ladies , [neither the mysterious disembodied voices]781-neither the mysterious disembodied voices , nor the still more incorporeal print , had made the faintest attempt to tell [them]771-every villager that . It was better not ; for , in the first place , [no one]533-no one knew . And , in the second place , why mention the particular when [the general]662-the general would serve ? Why draw attention , even , to the fact that [the general]662-the general is made up of [the particular]785-the particular ; or to the political certainty that promise is never performance ? Better , far better , to make large loose assertion , abuse the other side , and call [the electors the sanest and soundest body of people in [the world]787-the world]786-the electors the sanest and soundest body of people in the world . [Dinny]261-dinny was not canvassing . [She]261-dinny was no good at it , [she]261-dinny said ; and , perhaps , secretly [she]261-dinny perceived the peculiarity of the custom . [Clare]302-clare , if [she]302-clare noticed any irony about the business , was too anxious to be doing something to abstain . [She]302-clare was greatly helped by the way [everybody]788-everybody took it . [They]788-everybody had always been canvassed , and [they]788-everybody always would be . It was a harmless enough diversion to [their]788-everybody ears , rather like the buzzing of gnats that did not bite . As to [their]788-everybody votes , [they]788-everybody would record [them]788-everybody for quite other reasons because [[their]788-everybody fathers]789-their fathers had voted this or that before [them]788-everybody , because of something connected with [their]788-everybody occupation , because of [[their]788-everybody landlords]790-their landlords , [[their]788-everybody churches]791-their churches , or [[their]788-everybody trades unions]792-their trades unions ; because [they]788-everybody wanted a change , while not expecting anything much from it ; and not a few because of [their]788-everybody common sense . [Clare]302-clare , dreading questions , pattered as little as possible and came quickly to [[their]788-everybody babies]793-their babies or [their]788-everybody health . [She]302-clare generally ended by asking what time [they]788-everybody would like to be fetched . Noting the hour in a little book , [she]302-clare would come out not much the wiser . Being [a Charwell]794-a charwell that is to say , no foreigner [she]302-clare was taken as a matter of course ; and though not , like [Dinny]261-dinny , personally known to [them]788-everybody all , [she]302-clare was part of [an institution]795-an institution , [Condaford]10-condaford without [Charwells]267-the charwells being still almost inconceivable . [She]302-clare was driving back from this dutiful pastime towards [the Grange]24-the grange about four o clock on the Saturday before the election , when a voice from [an overtaking two - seater]796-an overtaking two - seater called [her]302-clare name , and [she]302-clare saw young [Tony Croom]220-dinny . What on earth are [you]220-dinny doing here , [Tony]220-dinny ? [I]0-i couldn t go any longer without a glimpse of [you]220-dinny . But , [[my]0-i dear boy]797-my dear boy , to come down here is too terribly pointed . [I]0-i know , but [I]0-i ve seen [you]220-dinny . [You]220-dinny weren t going to call , were [you]220-dinny ? If [I]0-i didn t see [you]220-dinny otherwise . [Clare]302-clare , [you]220-dinny look so lovely ! That , if true , is not a reason for queering [my]0-i pitch at [home]486-home . The last thing [I]0-i want to do ; but [I]0-i ve got to see [you]220-dinny now and then , otherwise [I]0-i shall go batty . [His]0-i face was so earnest and [his]0-i voice so moved , that [Clare]302-clare felt for the first time stirred in that hackneyed region , the heart . That s bad , [she]302-clare said ; because [I]0-i ve got to find [my]0-i feet , and [I]0-i can t have complications . Let [me]0-i kiss [you]0-i just once . Then [I]0-i should go back happy . Still more stirred , [Clare]302-clare thrust forward [her]302-clare cheek . Well , quick ! [she]302-clare said . [He]0-i glued [his]0-i lips to [her]302-clare cheek , but when [he]0-i tried to reach [her]302-clare lips [she]302-clare drew back . No . Now [Tony]220-dinny , [you]220-dinny must go . If [you]0-i re to see [me]0-i , it must be in [Town]799-town . But what is the good of seeing [me]0-i ? It ll only make [us]800-us unhappy . Bless [you]0-i for that [us]800-us . [Clare]302-clare s brown eyes smiled ; their colour was like that of a glass of Malaga wine held up to the light . Have [you]220-dinny found a job ? There are none . It ll be better when the election s over . [I]0-i M thinking of trying to get with [a milliner]801-a milliner . [You]220-dinny ! [I]0-i must do something . [[My]0-i people here]802-my people here are as hard pressed as [everybody else]803-everybody else . Now , [Tony]220-dinny , [you]220-dinny said [you]220-dinny d go . Promise to let [me]0-i know the first day [you]220-dinny come up . [Clare]302-clare nodded , and re - started [her]302-clare engine . As [the car]532-the car slid forward gently , [she]302-clare turned [her]302-clare face and gave [him]0-i another smile . [He]0-i continued to stand with [his]0-i hands to [his]0-i head till [the car]532-the car rounded a bend and [she]302-clare was gone . Turning [the car]532-the car into [the stable yard]807-the stable yard , [she]302-clare was thinking [Poor boy]808-poor boy ! and feeling the better for it . Whatever [her]302-clare position in the eyes of the law , or according to morality , [a young and pretty woman]809-a young and pretty woman breathes more easily when inhaling the incense of devotion . [She]302-clare may have strict intentions , but [she]302-clare has also a sense of what is due to [her]302-clare , and a dislike of waste . [Clare]302-clare looked the prettier and felt the happier all that evening . But the night was ridden by the moon ; nearly full , it soared up in front of [her]302-clare window , discouraging sleep . [She]302-clare got up and parted the curtains . Huddling into [her]302-clare fur coat , [she]302-clare stood at the window . There was evidently a frost , and a ground mist stretched like fleece over [the fields]676-the fields . The tall elms , ragged - edged , seemed to be sailing slowly along over the white vapour . The earth out there was unknown by [her]302-clare , as if it had dropped from that moon . [She]302-clare shivered . It might be beautiful , but it was cold , uncanny ; a frozen glamour . [She]302-clare thought of the nights in [the Red Sea]12-the red sea , when [she]302-clare lay with bedclothes thrown off , and the very moon seemed hot . On board [that ship]811-that ship [people]574-people had talked about [her]302-clare and [Tony]220-dinny [she]302-clare had seen many signs of it , and hadn t cared . Why should [she]302-clare ? [He]813-he had not even kissed [her]302-clare all those days . Not even the evening [he]813-he came to [[her]302-clare state - room]814-her state - room and [she]302-clare had shown [him]813-he photographs , and [they]815-they had talked . [A nice boy]816-a nice boy , modest and [a gentleman]817-a gentleman ! And if [he]813-he was in love , now , [she]302-clare couldn t help it [she]302-clare hadn t tried to vamp [him]813-he . As to what would happen , life always tripped one up , it seemed , whatever [one]604-one did ! Things must take care of [themselves]819-themselves . To make resolutions , plans , lay down what was called a line of conduct , was not the slightest use ! [She]302-clare had tried that with [Jerry]213-jerry . [She]302-clare shivered , then laughed , then went rigid with a sort of fury . No ! If [Tony]220-dinny expected [her]302-clare to rush into [his]813-he arms [he]813-he was very much mistaken . Sensual love ! [She]302-clare knew it inside out . No , thank [you]820-you ! As that moonlight , now , [she]302-clare was cold ! Impossible to speak of it even to [[her]302-clare Mother]658-her mother , whatever [she]658-her mother and [Dad]232-dad might be thinking . [Dinny]220-dinny must have told [them]822-them something , for [they]822-them had been most awfully decent . But even [Dinny]220-dinny didn t know . [Nobody]606-nobody should ever know ! If only [she]302-clare had money it wouldn t matter . Ruined life , of course , and all that , was just old - fashioned tosh . Life could always be amusing if [one]604-one made it so . [She]302-clare was not going to skulk and mope . Far from that ! But money [she]302-clare must somehow make . [She]302-clare shivered even in [her]302-clare fur coat . The moonlight seemed to creep into one s bones . [These old houses]825-these old houses no central heating , because [they]825-these old houses couldn t afford to put it in ! The moment the election was over [she]302-clare would go up to [London]25-london and scout round . [Fleur]221-fleur might know of something . If there was no future in hats , [one]604-one might get a political secretaryship . [She]302-clare could type , [she]302-clare knew French well , [people]574-people could read [her]302-clare handwriting . [She]302-clare could drive [a car]828-a car with [anybody]512-anybody , or school a horse . [She]302-clare knew all about country house life , manners , and precedence . [She]302-clare d had quite a lot of experience with dogs , and some with flowers , especially the arrangement of them in bowls and vases . And if it were a question of knowing anything about politics , [she]302-clare could soon mug that up . So , in that illusory cold moonshine , [Clare]302-clare could not see how [they]830-lots of members who wanted somebody like her , who could tell them how to dress , and how to decline this and that without anybody minding , and generally do their crossword puzzles for them could fail to need [her]302-clare . With a salary and [her]302-clare own two hundred a year [she]302-clare could get along quite well ! The moon , behind an elm tree now , no longer had its devastating impersonality , but rather an air of bright intrigue , peeping through those still thick boughs with a conspiring eye . [She]302-clare hugged [herself]302-clare , danced a few steps to warm [her]302-clare feet , and slipped back into [her]302-clare bed . . . . [Young Croom]268-young croom , in [[his]833-he [borrowed two - seater]835-borrowed two - seater]834-his borrowed two - seater , had returned to [Town]799-town at an unobtrusive sixty miles an hour . [His]833-he first kiss on [Clare]302-clare s cold but glowing cheek had given [him]833-he slight delirium . It was an immense step forward . [He]833-he was not [a vicious young man]837-a vicious young man . That [Clare]302-clare was married was to [him]833-he no advantage . But whether , if [she]302-clare had not been married , [his]833-he feelings towards [her]302-clare would have been of quite the same brand , was a question [he]833-he left unexamined . The subtle difference which creeps into the charm of [a woman who has known physical love]838-a woman who has known physical love , and the sting which the knowledge of that implants in [a man]632-a man s senses such is food for [a psychologist]840-a psychologist rather than for [a straightforward young man really in love for the first time]841-a straightforward young man really in love for the first time . [He]833-he wanted [her]302-clare , as [[his]833-he wife]842-his wife if possible ; if that were not possible , in any other way that was . [He]833-he had been in [Ceylon]6-ceylon three years , hard - worked , seeing [few white women]843-few white women , and [none that [he]833-he had cared for]844-none that he had cared for . [His]833-he passion had , hitherto , been for polo , and [his]833-he meeting with [Clare]302-clare had come just as [he]833-he had lost both job and polo . [Clare]302-clare filled for [him]833-he a yawning gap . As with [Clare]302-clare , so with [him]833-he in the matter of money , only more so . [He]833-he had some two hundred pounds saved , and would then be bang up against it unless [he]833-he got a job . Having returned [the two - seater]845-the two - seater to [[his]833-he friend s garage]846-his friend s garage , [he]833-he considered where [he]833-he could dine most cheaply , and decided on [[his]833-he club]847-his club . [He]833-he was practically living [there]605-there , except for [a bedroom in [Ryder Street]26-ryder street , where [he]833-he slept and breakfasted on tea and boiled eggs]849-a bedroom in ryder street , where he slept and breakfasted on tea and boiled eggs . [A simple room]850-a simple room [it]850-a simple room was , on the ground floor , with a bed and a dress cupboard , looking out on the tall back of [another building]851-another building , [the sort of room that [[his]833-he father]716-his father]852-the sort of room that his father [, coming on [the Town]855-the town in the nineties , had slept and breakfasted in for half the money]854-, coming on the town in the nineties , had slept and breakfasted in for half the money . On Saturday nights [the Coffee House]506-the coffee house was deserted , save for a certain number of old buffers accustomed to week - ending in [St. James s Street]27-st. james s street . [Young Croom]268-young croom ordered the three - course dinner and ate it to the last crumb . [He]833-he drank Bass , and went down to [the smoking - room]857-the smoking - room for a pipe . About to sink into an armchair , [he]833-he noticed standing before the fire [a tallish thin man with twisting dark eyebrows and a little white moustache]858-a tallish thin man with twisting dark eyebrows and a little white moustache , who was examining [him]833-he through a tortoiseshell - rimmed monocle . Acting on the impulse of [a lover craving connection with [[his]833-he lady]860-his lady]859-a lover craving connection with his lady , [he]833-he said : Excuse [me]0-i , [sir]520-sir , but aren t [you]520-sir [Sir Lawrence Mont]217-sir lawrence ? That has been [my]0-i lifelong conviction . [Young Croom]268-young croom smiled . Then , [sir]520-sir , [I]0-i met [[your]520-sir niece]863-your niece , [Lady Corven]269-lady corven , coming [home]486-home from [Ceylon]6-ceylon . [She]269-lady corven said [you]833-he were [a member]865-a member [here]866-here . [My]0-i name s [Croom]268-young croom . Yes , [he]690-your father put [me]0-i down at birth . [I]0-i believe [I]0-i m about [the youngest in [the Club]870-the club]869-the youngest in the club . [Sir Lawrence]217-sir lawrence nodded . So [you]833-he met [Clare]302-clare . How was [she]302-clare ? All right , [I]0-i think , [sir]520-sir . Let s sit down and talk about [Ceylon]6-ceylon . Cigar ? Thank [you]520-sir , [sir]520-sir , [I]0-i have [my]0-i pipe . Coffee , anyway ? [Waiter]873-waiter , two coffees . [[My]0-i wife]874-my wife is down at [Condaford]10-condaford staying with [[Clare]302-clare s people]875-clare s people . [An attractive young woman]876-an attractive young woman . Noting those dark eyes , rather like a snipe s , fixed on [him]520-sir , [young Croom]268-young croom regretted [his]520-sir impulse . [He]520-sir had gone red , but [he]520-sir said bravely : Yes , [sir]520-sir , [I]0-i thought [her]874-my wife delightful . Do [you]520-sir know [Corven]269-lady corven ? No , said [young Croom]268-young croom shortly . [Clever fellow]878-clever fellow . Did [you]520-sir like [Ceylon]6-ceylon ? Oh ! yes . But it s given [me]0-i up . Not going back ? Afraid not . It s a long time since [I]0-i was [there]605-there . [India]14-india has rather smothered it . Been in [India]14-india ? No , [sir]520-sir . Difficult to know how far [the people of [India]14-india]881-the people of india really want to cut the painter . [Seventy per cent peasants]882-seventy per cent peasants ! [Peasants]883-peasants want stable conditions and a quiet life . [I]0-i remember in [Egypt]28-egypt before the war there was a strong nationalist agitation , but [the fellaheen]884-the fellaheen were all for [Kitchener]270-kitchener and stable British rule . [We]885-we took [Kitchener]270-kitchener away and gave [them]884-the fellaheen unstable conditions in the war , and so [they]884-the fellaheen went on the other tack . What were [you]520-sir doing in [Ceylon]6-ceylon ? Running [a tea plantation]565-a tea plantation . But [they]884-the fellaheen took up economy , amalgamated [three plantations]887-three plantations , and [I]0-i wasn t wanted any more . Do [you]520-sir think there s going to be a recovery , [sir]520-sir ? [I]0-i can t understand economics . [Nobody]606-nobody can . There are dozens of causes of the present state of things , and [people]574-people are always trying to tie it to one . Take [England]5-england : There s the knock - out of Russian trade , the comparative independence of [European countries]891-european countries , the great shrinkage of Indian and Chinese trade ; the higher standard of British living since the war ; the increase of national expenditure from two hundred - odd millions to eight hundred millions , which means nearly six hundred millions a year less to employ labour with . When [they]884-the fellaheen talk of over - production being the cause , it certainly doesn t apply to [us]885-we . [We]885-we haven t produced so little for a long time past . Then there s dumping , and shocking bad organisation , and bad marketing of what little food [we]885-we produce . And there s [our]885-we habit of thinking it ll be all right on the night , and general spoiled - child attitude . Well , those are all special English causes , except that the too high standard of living and the spoiled - child attitude are American too . And the other American causes , [sir]520-sir ? [The Americans]271-the americans certainly have over - produced and over - speculated . And [they]271-the americans ve been living so high that [they]271-the americans ve mortgaged [their]271-the americans future instalment system and all that . Then [they]271-the americans re sitting on gold , and gold doesn t hatch out . And , more than all , [they]271-the americans don t realise yet that the money [they]271-the americans lent to [Europe]29-europe during the war was practically money [they]271-the americans d made out of the war . When [they]271-the americans agree to general cancellation of debts [they]271-the americans ll be agreeing to general recovery , including [their]271-the americans own . But will [they]271-the americans ever agree ? [You]893-you never know what [the Americans]894-the americans will do , [they]271-the americans re looser - jointed than [we]885-we of [the old world]895-the old world . [They]271-the americans re capable of the big thing , even in [their]271-the americans own interests . Are [you]893-you out of a job ? Very much so . What s [your]893-you record ? [I]0-i was at [Wellington]30-wellington and at [Cambridge]31-cambridge for two years . Then this tea thing came along , and [I]0-i took it like a bird . What age are [you]893-you ? Twenty - six . Any notion of what [you]893-you want to do ? [Young Croom]268-young croom sat forward . Really , [sir]520-sir , [I]0-i d have a shot at anything . But [I]0-i m pretty good with horses . [It]900-it s queer about the horse [he]901-he s coming in as [he]901-he goes out . On that cold and misty evening , which all the newspapers had agreed was to make history , [the Charwells]267-the charwells sat in [the drawing - room at [Condaford]10-condaford]915-the drawing - room at condaford round the portable wireless , a present from [Fleur]221-fleur . Would the voice breathe o er Eden , or would it be the striking of Fate s clock ? Not one of those five but was solemnly convinced that the future of [Great Britain]32-great britain hung in the balance ; convinced , too , that [their]267-the charwells conviction was detached from class or party . Patriotism divorced from thought of vested interest governed , as [they]267-the charwells supposed , [their]267-the charwells mood . And if [they]267-the charwells made a mistake in so thinking , quite [a number of [other Britons]917-other britons]916-a number of other britons were making it too . Across [Dinny]220-dinny s mind , indeed , did flit the thought : Does [anyone]918-anyone know what will save [the country]573-the country and what won t ? But , even by [her]302-clare , time and tide , incalculably rolling , swaying and moulding the lives of [nations]920-nations , was ungauged . Newspapers and [politicians]921-politicians had done [their]267-the charwells work and stamped the moment for [her]302-clare as a turning point . In a sea - green dress , [she]302-clare sat , close to the present from [Fleur]221-fleur , waiting to turn it on at ten o clock , and regulate its stridency . [Aunt Em]236-aunt em was working at a new piece of French tapestry , [her]236-aunt em slight aquilinity emphasised by tortoise - shell spectacles . [The General]662-the general nervously turned and re - turned The Times and kept taking out [his]662-the general watch . [Lady Charwell]259-lady charwell sat still and a little forward , like [a child in Sunday School]923-a child in sunday school before [she]259-lady charwell has become convinced that [she]259-lady charwell is going to be bored . And [Clare]302-clare lay on the sofa , with the dog [Foch]240-foch on [her]302-clare feet . Time , [Dinny]220-dinny , said [the General]662-the general ; turn the thing on . [Dinny]220-dinny fingered a screw , and the thing burst into music . [The General]662-the general added : H m ! and the music began again . [Aunt Em]236-aunt em , looking at the portable , said : Coax it , [Dinny]220-dinny . Again and again the music spurted up and died away ; and the voice spoke . [Dinny]220-dinny , with knees crossed and eyes closed , was thinking : Will it really make a difference ; and , if it does , shall [I]0-i care ? Where is [HE]936-he ? Listening as [we]937-we are ? Where ? Where ? Not so often now , but quite often enough , that sense of groping for [Wilfrid]237-wilfrid returned to [her]302-clare . Having kissed [[her]302-clare father]942-her father and [Clare]302-clare , [she]302-clare turned out the lights and waited in [the hall]943-the hall . The wood fire had almost died . [England]5-england silvered and indifferent to [her]5-england fate , disbelieving in the Voice o er [Eden]37-eden ; old and permanent and beautiful , even though the pound had gone off gold . How queer the passionate intensity of [one]604-one [s]604-one heart , and the incalculable cold callousness of Time and Space ! To join , to reconcile ? . . . [She]961-she shivered and shut the door . Where [I]0-i went canvassing in [the town]855-the town [they]965-they were [all Liberals]966-all liberals . [I]0-i just used the word national , and [they]965-they fell . Chapter 6

Three days after [their]996-their meeting at [the Coffee House]506-the coffee house , [young Croom]220-dinny received a letter from [Sir Lawrence Mont]217-sir lawrence , saying that [[his]994-he cousin]998-his cousin [Muskham]272-jack muskham was not expecting [the Arab mares]999-the arab mares till the spring . No , thought [young Croom]216-mr. croom , but [I]0-i know [Stapylton]283-stapylton . [Stapylton]283-stapylton , of [the Lancers]1000-the lancers , who had been [his]283-stapylton senior at [Wellington]30-wellington , was home from [India]14-india on leave . [A noted polo player]1001-a noted polo player , [he]283-stapylton would be sure to know the horse jargon of [the East]22-the east ; but , having broken [his]283-stapylton thigh - bone schooling [a steeplechaser]1002-a steeplechaser , [he]283-stapylton would keep ; the business of finding an immediate job of work would not . [Young Croom]268-young croom continued [his]216-mr. croom researches . [Everyone]617-everyone said : Wait till the election s over ! On the morning after the election , therefore , [he]216-mr. croom issued from [Ryder Street]26-ryder street with the greater expectation , and , on the evening after , returned to [the Coffee House]506-the coffee house , with the less , thinking : [I]0-i might just as well have gone to [Newmarket]41-newmarket and seen [the Cambridgeshire]284-the cambridgeshire . [The porter]1005-the porter handed [him]216-mr. croom a note , and [his]216-mr. croom heart began to thump . [[Your]214-tony shipmate and well - wisher]1010-your shipmate and well - wisher , [CLARE CORVEN]285-clare corven . [The darling]1011-the darling ! [he]285-clare corven thought . What luck ! [He]285-clare corven read the note again , placed it beneath the cigarette case in [his]285-clare corven left - hand waistcoat pocket , and went into [the smoking - room]857-the smoking - room . There , on a sheet of paper stamped with the Club s immemorial design , [he]285-clare corven poured out an ingenuous heart : [DARLING CLARE]302-clare [Your]302-clare note has perked [me]0-i up no end . That [you]302-clare will be in [Town]4-town is magnificent news . [[Your]302-clare uncle]1013-your uncle has been very kind to [me]0-i , and [I]0-i shall simply have to call and thank [him]1013-your uncle . So do look out for [me]0-i about six o clock tomorrow . [I]0-i spend all [my]0-i time hunting a job , and am beginning to realise what it means to [poor devils]1014-poor devils to be turned down day after day . When [my]0-i pouch is empty , and that s not far away , it ll be even worse for [me]0-i . No dole for [this child]1015-this child , unfortunately . [I]0-i hope the pundit [you]302-clare re going to take in hand is a decent sort . [I]0-i always think of [M.P.]286-m.p. s as a bit on the wooden side . And somehow [I]0-i can t see [you]302-clare among Bills and petitions and letters about public - house licences and so forth . However , [I]0-i think [you]302-clare re splendid to want to be independent . What [a thumping majority]1016-a thumping majority ! If [they]1016-a thumping majority can t do things with that behind [them]1016-a thumping majority , [they]1016-a thumping majority can t do things at all . It s quite impossible for [me]0-i not to be in love with [you]302-clare , [you]302-clare know , and to long to be with [you]302-clare all day and all night , too . But [I]0-i m going to be as good as [I]0-i can , because the very last thing [I]0-i want is to cause [you]302-clare uneasiness of any sort . [I]0-i think of [you]302-clare all the time , even when [I]0-i m searching the marble countenance of [some fish - faced blighter]1017-some fish - faced blighter to see if [my]0-i piteous tale is weakening [his]1017-some fish - faced blighter judgment . The fact is [I]0-i love [you]302-clare terribly . To - morrow , Thursday , about six ! Good - night , [dear and lovely one]1018-dear and lovely one , [[YOUR]302-clare TONY]1019-your tony . Having looked up [Sir Lawrence]217-sir lawrence s number in [Mount Street]43-mount street , [he]1019-your tony addressed the note , licked the envelope with passion , and went out to post it [himself]1019-your tony . Then , suddenly , [he]1019-your tony did not feel inclined to return to [the Coffee House]506-the coffee house . [The place]1021-the place had a grudge against [his]1019-your tony state of mind . [Clubs]1022-clubs were so damned male , and [their]1022-clubs whole attitude to [women]1023-women so after - dinnerish half contempt , half lechery ! Funk - holes [they]1022-clubs were , anyway , full of comfort , secured against [women]1023-women , immune from writs ; and [men]959-men all had the same armchair look once [they]959-men got inside . [The Coffee House]506-the coffee house , too , about the oldest of all clubs , was stuffed with regular buffers , [men]959-men [you]1028-you couldn t imagine outside [a club]1029-a club . No ! [he]1019-your tony thought . [I]0-i ll have a chop somewhere , and go to that thing at [Drury Lane]44-drury lane . [He]1019-your tony got a seat rather far back in the upper boxes , but , [his]1019-your tony sight being very good , [he]1019-your tony saw quite well . [He]1019-your tony was soon absorbed . [He]1019-your tony had been out of [England]5-england long enough to have some sentiment about [her]1023-women . This pictorial pageant of [her]1023-women history for the last thirty years moved [him]1019-your tony more than [he]1019-your tony would have confessed to [anyone sitting beside [him]1019-your tony]1030-anyone sitting beside him . [He]1019-your tony took a cigarette from [his]1019-your tony case and lighted it . [I]0-i must absolutely have a drink , [he]1019-your tony thought . [The Club]870-the club seemed possible again now , even inviting , and [he]1019-your tony made towards [it]870-the club . The quality which from time immemorial has made [the public men of [England]5-england]1386-the public men of england what [they]1386-the public men of england are , tempted so many lawyers into Parliament , caused [so many divines]1387-so many divines to put up with being [bishops]1388-bishops , floated [so many financiers]1389-so many financiers , saved so many [politicians]921-politicians from taking thought for the morrow , and so many [judges]1391-judges from the pangs of remorse , was present in [Eustace Dornford]278-dornford to no small degree . Put more shortly , [he]213-jerry had an excellent digestion ; could eat and drink at all times without knowing anything about it afterwards . [He]213-jerry was [an indefatigably hard worker even at play]1392-an indefatigably hard worker even at play ; and there was in [him]213-jerry just that added fund of nervous energy which differentiates [the man who wins the long jump]1393-the man who wins the long jump from [the man who loses it]1394-the man who loses it . And now , though [his]213-jerry practice was going up by leaps and bounds since , two years ago , [he]213-jerry had taken silk , [he]213-jerry had stood for [Parliament]61-parliament . And yet [he]213-jerry was [the last sort of man to incur the epithet go - getter]1395-the last sort of man to incur the epithet go - getter . [His]213-jerry pale - brown , hazel - eyed , well - featured face had a considerate , even a sensitive look , and a pleasant smile . [He]213-jerry had kept a little fine dark moustache , and [his]213-jerry wig had not yet depleted [his]213-jerry natural hair , which was dark and of rather curly texture . After Oxford [he]213-jerry had eaten dinners and gone into [the Chambers of [a well - known Common Law Junior]1397-a well - known common law junior]1396-the chambers of a well - known common law junior . Being [a subaltern in [the Shropshire Yeomanry]1399-the shropshire yeomanry]1398-a subaltern in the shropshire yeomanry when the war broke out , [he]213-jerry had passed into [the Cavalry]1400-the cavalry , and not long after into the trenches , where [he]213-jerry had known better luck than [most people]1401-most people . [His]213-jerry rise at [the Bar]717-the bar after the war had been rapid . [Solicitors]1403-solicitors liked [him]213-jerry . [He]213-jerry never fell foul of [judges]1391-judges , and as [a cross - examiner]1405-a cross - examiner stood out , because [he]213-jerry almost seemed to regret the points [he]213-jerry scored . [He]213-jerry was [a Roman Catholic]1406-a roman catholic , from breeding rather than observance . Finally , [he]213-jerry was fastidious in matters of sex , and [his]213-jerry presence at a dinner - table on circuit had , if not a silencing , at least a moderating effect on tongues . [He]213-jerry occupied in [Harcourt Buildings]62-harcourt buildings a commodious set of chambers designed for life as well as learning . Early every morning , wet or fine , [he]213-jerry went for a ride in [the Row]1407-the row , having already done at least two hours work on [his]213-jerry cases . By ten o clock , bathed , breakfasted , and acquainted with the morning s news , [he]213-jerry was ready for the Courts . When at four [those Courts]99-the courts rose , [he]213-jerry was busy again till half - past six on [his]213-jerry cases . The evenings , hitherto free , would now be spent at [the House]1408-the house : and since it would be seldom that [he]213-jerry could go to bed without working an hour or so on some case or other , [his]213-jerry sleep was likely to be curtailed from six hours to five , or even four . The arrangement come to with [Clare]311-clare was simple . [She]311-clare arrived at a quarter to ten , opened [his]213-jerry correspondence , and took [his]213-jerry instructions from ten to a quarter past . [She]311-clare remained to do what was necessary , and came again at six o clock , ready for anything fresh or left over . On the evening after that last described , at the hour of eight - fifteen , [he]213-jerry entered [the drawing - room in [Mount Street]43-mount street]1409-the drawing - room in mount street , was greeted , and introduced to [Adrian]293-adrian , who had again been bidden . Discussing the state of the pound and other grave matters , [they]1410-we waited , till [Lady Mont]243-lady mont said suddenly : [Soup]312-soup . What have [you]213-jerry done with [Clare]311-clare , [Mr. Dornford]235-dornford ? [She]311-clare left [the Temple]1412-the temple at half - past six , saying [we]1410-we should meet again . Then , said [Lady Mont]243-lady mont , [we]1410-we ll go down . There followed one of those discomfortable hours well known to [well - bred people]1413-well - bred people , when four of [them]1413-well - bred people are anxious upon a subject which [they]1413-well - bred people must not broach to the fifth , and [the fifth]1414-the fifth becomes aware of this anxiety . [They]1413-well - bred people were , indeed , too few for the occasion , for all that each one of [them]1413-well - bred people said could be heard by [the others]1344-the others . It was impossible for [Eustace Dornford]278-dornford to be confidential with [either of [[his]278-dornford neighbours]1417-his neighbours]1416-either of his neighbours ; and since [he]278-dornford instinctively felt that without a preliminary confidence [he]278-dornford would only put [his]278-dornford foot into it , [he]278-dornford was careful to be public - minded and keep to such topics as the Premier , the undiscovered identity of [certain poisoners]1418-certain poisoners , the ventilation of [the House of Commons]1419-the house of commons , the difficulty of knowing exactly what to do with one s hat there , and other subjects of general interest . When [Sir Lawrence Mont]217-sir lawrence reached [Burton s Club]66-burton s club the following afternoon [he]217-sir lawrence was feeling , in common with [many who undertake to interfere in the affairs of [others]1498-others]1497-many who undertake to interfere in the affairs of others , an uneasy self - importance coupled with a desire to be somewhere else . [He]217-sir lawrence did not know what the deuce [he]217-sir lawrence was going to say to [Corven]269-lady corven , or why [the deuce]1499-the deuce [he]217-sir lawrence should say it , since , in [his]217-sir lawrence opinion , by far the best solution would be for [Clare]302-clare to give [her]302-clare marriage another trial . Having discovered from [the porter]1005-the porter that [Sir Gerald]213-jerry was in [the Club]870-the club , [he]217-sir lawrence poked [his]217-sir lawrence nose gingerly into [three rooms]1502-three rooms before locating the back of [[his]217-sir lawrence quarry]1503-his quarry seated in the corner of [an apartment]1504-an apartment too small to be devoted to anything but writing . [He]217-sir lawrence sat down at a table close to the door , so that [he]217-sir lawrence could simulate surprise when [Corven]269-lady corven came up to leave [the room]1076-the room . [The fellow]667-the fellow was an unconscionable time . Noting a copy of [the British Statesman s vade - mecum]1507-the british statesman s vade - mecum beside [him]217-sir lawrence , [he]217-sir lawrence began idly looking up the figures of British imports . [He]217-sir lawrence found potatoes : consumption sixty - six million five hundred thousand tons , production eight million eight hundred and seventy - four thousand tons ! [Somebody the other day]1508-somebody the other day had written to say that [we]1509-our imported forty million pounds worth of bacon every year . Taking a sheet of paper [he]217-sir lawrence wrote : Prohibition and protection , in regard to food that [we]1509-our CAN produce [here]866-here . Annual Imports : [Pigs]316-pigs , 40,000,000 ; Poultry say , 12,000,000 ; [Potatoes God]218-god knows how much ! All this bacon , all these eggs , and half these potatoes could be produced [here]866-here . Why not a five - year plan ? By prohibition lessen the import of bacon and eggs one - fifth every year , and the import of potatoes by one - tenth every year , increasing [home]486-home production gradually to replace them . At the end of five years [our]1509-our bacon and eggs and half [our]1509-our potatoes would be all - British . [We]1509-our should save eighty millions on [our]1509-our Imports Bill and [our]1509-our trade would practically be balanced . Taking another sheet of paper , [he]217-sir lawrence wrote : To [the Editor of The Times]1513-the editor of the times . The Three P. Plan . SIR A simple plan for the balancing of [our]1509-our trade would seem to merit the attention of [all those not wedded]1514-all those not wedded to the longest way round . There are three articles of food on importing which [we]1509-our expend annually some pounds , but which could be produced in [[our]1509-our own country]1515-our own country without , [I]0-i venture to think , causing the price of living to rise to any material extent if [we]1509-our took the simple precaution of hanging [a profiteer at the beginning]1516-a profiteer at the beginning . These articles are Pigs , [Poultry]317-poultry , [Potatoes]218-god . There would be no need to put on duties , for all that is required is But at this moment , becoming aware that [Corven]269-lady corven was passing from [the room]1076-the room , [he]217-sir lawrence said : Hallo ! [Corven]269-lady corven turned and came towards [him]217-sir lawrence . Sorry [I]0-i didn t see [you]217-sir lawrence when [you]217-sir lawrence called the other day . Have [you]217-sir lawrence got long leave ? Another week only , and then [I]0-i shall have to fly [the Mediterranean probably]67-the mediterranean probably . Not a good month for flying . What do [you]217-sir lawrence think of this adverse balance of trade ? [Jerry Corven]213-jerry shrugged . Something to keep [them]1519-them busy for a bit . [They]1519-them never see two inches before [their]1519-them noses . [Tiens]318-tiens ! [Une montagne]68-une montagne ! And [his]0-i thoughts went back to [Corven]269-lady corven . Impossible , in such cases , to know where the blame really lay . [Here]866-here was change enough ! [The houses of the great]1596-the houses of the great were going fast . Piecemeal , without expressed aim , almost shamefacedly , in true English fashion , [London]25-london was being rebuilt . The dynastic age was gone , with its appendages , feudalism , and [the Church]75-the church . Even wars would now be fought for [peoples]1597-peoples and [their]1597-peoples markets . No more dynastic or religious wars . Well , that was something ! [We]1598-we re getting more like insects daily , thought [Sir Lawrence]217-sir lawrence . And how interesting ! Religion was nearly dead because there was no longer real belief in future life ; but something was struggling to take its place service social service the ants creed , the bees creed ! [Communism]326-communism had formulated it and was whipping it into [the people]591-the people from the top . So characteristic ! [They]1600-they were always whipping something into [somebody]1601-somebody in [Russia]76-russia . The quick way , no doubt , but the sure way ? No ! The voluntary system remained the best , because when once it got hold it lasted only it was so darned slow ! Yes , and darned ironical ! On Sunday morning [she]302-clare lay long in bed , with the windows wide open , watching the sky beyond the tall denuded elms . The sun shone in upon [her]302-clare , the air was mild and alive with sounds surprised into life , the twittering once more of birds , the lowing of a cow , the occasional caw of a rook , the continual cooing of the fantails . There was but little poetry in [Clare]302-clare , but for a moment to [her]302-clare easeful stretched - out being came a certain perception of the symphony which is [this world]1621-this world . The lacing of the naked boughs and those few leaves against the soft , gold - bright , moving sky ; that rook balancing there ; [the green and fallow upland]1622-the green and fallow upland , the far line of trees ; and all those sounds , and the pure unscented air on [her]302-clare face ; the twittering quietude and perfect freedom of each separate thing , and yet the long composure of design all this for a moment drew [her]302-clare out of [herself]302-clare into a glimpse of the universal . [She]302-clare felt that [he]662-the general could have stood it with equanimity of [[someone else]1280-someone else s daughter]1702-someone else s daughter ; [she]302-clare remembered that [he]662-the general had even sympathised with [[her]302-clare brother]1270-her brother s flogging of the muleteer , which had brought such a peck of trouble on [them]1704-them all . How little detached , how delightfully personal , [people]574-people were ! Feeling and criticising in terms of [their]574-people own prejudices ! Well ! [She]302-clare was over the worst now , for [[her]302-clare people]1706-her people were on [her]302-clare side , and [she]302-clare would make certain of not seeing [Jerry]213-jerry alone again . [She]302-clare thought of the long look [he]662-the general had given [her]302-clare . [He]662-the general was [a good loser]1707-a good loser , because for [him]662-the general the game was never at an end . Life itself not each item of life absorbed [him]662-the general . [He]662-the general rode [Life]323-life , took a toss , got up , rode on ; met an obstacle , rode over it , rode through it , took the scratches as all in the day s work . [He]662-the general had fascinated [her]302-clare , ridden through and over [her]302-clare ; the fascination was gone , and [she]302-clare wondered that it had ever been . What was [he]662-the general going to do now ? Well ! One thing was certain : somehow , [he]662-the general would cut [his]662-the general losses ! Chapter 13

One who gazes at [the Temple]1412-the temple s smooth green turf , fine trees , [stone - silled buildings]1709-stone - silled buildings , and pouter pigeons , feels dithyrambic , till on [him]662-the general intrudes the vision of countless bundles of papers tied round with pink tape , unending clerks in [little outer chambers]1710-little outer chambers sucking thumbs and waiting for [solicitors]1403-solicitors , calf - bound tomes stored with reports of innumerable cases so closely argued that the light - minded sigh at sight of [them]1712-them and think of [the CafÃ© Royal]328-the cafÃ© royal . Who shall deny that [the Temple]1412-the temple harbours [the human mind]1714-the human mind in excelsis , the human body in chairs ; who shall gainsay that [the human spirit]1715-the human spirit is taken off at [its]1715-the human spirit entrances and left outside like the shoes of [those who enter [a mosque]1717-a mosque]1716-those who enter a mosque ? Not even to [its]1715-the human spirit Grand Nights is [the human spirit]1715-the human spirit admitted , for [the legal mind]1719-the legal mind must not slop over , and warning is given by the word Decorations on the invitation cards . Daverday]329-collister v. daverday : [Popdick]78-popdick intervening . Time has been compared with [a stream]1876-a stream , but it differs [you]1877-you can not cross [it]1876-a stream , grey and even - flowing , wide as [the world]787-the world itself , having neither [ford nor bridge]1879-ford nor bridge ; and though , according to philosophers , it may flow both up and down , the calendar as yet follows it but one way . November , then , became December , but December did not become November . Except for a cold snap or two the weather remained mild . Unemployment decreased ; the adverse balance of trade increased ; seven foxes escaped for every one killed ; the papers fluttered from the storms in [their]1880-their tea - cups ; a great deal of income tax was paid ; still more was not ; the question : Why has prosperity gone to pot ? continued to bewilder every mind ; the pound went up , the pound went down . In short , time flowed , but the conundrum of existence remained unsolved . At [Condaford]10-condaford the bakery scheme was dropped . Every penny that could be raised was to be put into pigs , poultry and potatoes . [Sir Lawrence]217-sir lawrence and [Michael]227-michael were now deep in the Three P. Plan , and [Dinny]302-clare had become infected . [She]302-clare and [the General]662-the general spent all [their]1882-their days preparing for the millennium which would follow its adoption . [Eustace Dornford]278-dornford had expressed [his]278-dornford adherence to the proposition . [Figures]341-figures had been prepared to show that in ten years one hundred millions a year could be knocked off [Britain]89-britain s purchasing bill by graduated prohibition of the import of these three articles of food , without increasing the cost of living . With a little organisation , a fractional change in the nature of [the Briton]342-the briton , and the increase of wheat offals , the thing was as good as done . In the meantime , [the General]662-the general borrowed slightly on [his]662-the general life assurance policy and paid [his]662-the general taxes . [The new Member]967-the new member , visiting [[his]662-the general constituency]1546-his constituency , spent Christmas at [Condaford]10-condaford , talking almost exclusively of pigs , instinct telling [him]662-the general that [they]1886-they were just then the surest line of approach to [Dinny]302-clare s heart . [Clare]302-clare , too , spent Christmas at [home]486-home . How , apart from secretarial duties , [she]302-clare had spent the intervening time , was tacitly assumed . No letter had come from [Jerry Corven]213-jerry , but it was known from the papers that [he]213-jerry was back in [Ceylon]6-ceylon . On the Monday after New Year s Day the party broke up . In the afternoon [Dinny]302-clare lay down on [her]302-clare bed and went to sleep . [She]302-clare awoke agonised . Through the window opposite was the dark sky , the elm tree brushing at the stars no sound , no scent , no colour . And [she]302-clare lay quite still , drawing deep breaths to get the better of [her]302-clare anguish . [He]349-benjy wobbled [his]349-benjy pippin head , rubbing [his]349-benjy hands on [his]349-benjy knees . Words of comfort refused to come to [Dinny]219-dinny . [She]219-dinny sat , silently watching [old Betty]247-liz s lips , whence issued that faintly stertorous breathing . It seemed to [her]219-dinny as if the spirit of a far - off age were dying . There might be [other people as old still alive in [the village]559-the village]1962-other people as old still alive in the village , but [they]1962-other people as old still alive in the village weren t like [old Betty]247-liz , with [her]247-liz simple sense and thrifty order , [her]247-liz Bible - reading and love of gentry , [her]247-liz pride in [her]247-liz eighty - three years , in the teeth that [she]247-liz ought long since to have parted from , and in [her]247-liz record ; with [her]247-liz shrewdness and [her]247-liz way of treating [[her]247-liz old husband]1964-her old husband as if [he]1964-her old husband were [[her]247-liz rather difficult son]1965-her rather difficult son . Perhaps [one of [[his]349-benjy granddaughters]1968-his granddaughters]1967-one of his granddaughters would find room for [him]349-benjy . [Those two]981-those two had brought up [seven children]1970-seven children in the old days when a shilling fortunately went as far as three now , and [the village]559-the village was full of [their]981-those two progeny ; but how would [they]981-those two like [little old Benjy]349-benjy , still argumentative and fond of a grumble and a glass , ensconced by [[their]981-those two more modern hearths]1972-their more modern hearths ? Two old age pensions for [two old people]1974-two old people made just the difference as against one for one . How [I]0-i wish [I]0-i had money ! [she]1975-she thought . [He]349-benjy would not want the goldfinch , anyway . [She]1975-she would take that , and free and feed [it]1976-it in [the old greenhouse]1977-the old greenhouse till it got used to its wings , and then let it go . [The old man]1978-the old man cleared [his]1978-the old man throat in [his]1978-the old man dim corner . [Dinny]219-dinny started and leaned forward . Absorbed in [her]219-dinny thoughts , [she]219-dinny had not noticed how faint the breathing had become . The pale lips of [the old woman]1959-the old woman were nearly closed now , the wrinkled lids almost fast over the unseeing eyes . No noise was coming from the bed . For a few minutes [she]219-dinny sat looking , listening ; then passed round to the side and leaned over . Gone ? As if in answer the eyelids flickered ; the faintest imaginable smile appeared on the lips , and then , suddenly as a blown - out flame is dark , all was lifeless . [Dinny]219-dinny held [her]219-dinny breath . It was the first human death [she]219-dinny had seen . [Her]219-dinny eyes , glued to the old waxen face , saw it settle into its mask of release , watched it being embalmed in that still dignity which marks death off from life . With [her]219-dinny finger [she]219-dinny smoothed the eyelids . Death ! At its quietest and least harrowing , but yet death ! The old , [the universal anodyne]1980-the universal anodyne ; the common lot ! In this bed where [she]219-dinny had lain nightly for over fifty years under the low , sagged ceiling , [a great little old lady]1981-a great little old lady had passed . Of what was called birth , of position , wealth , and power , [she]219-dinny had none . [No plumbing]1982-no plumbing had come [her]219-dinny way , no learning , and no fashion . [She]219-dinny had borne [children]1983-children , nursed , fed , and washed [them]1983-children , sewn , cooked , and swept , eaten little , travelled not at all in all [her]219-dinny years , suffered much pain , never known the ease of superfluity ; but [her]219-dinny back had been straight , [her]219-dinny ways straight , [her]219-dinny eyes quiet , and [her]219-dinny manners gentle . If [she]219-dinny were not [the great lady]1984-the great lady , who was ? [Dinny]219-dinny stood , with [her]219-dinny head bowed , feeling this to the very marrow of [her]219-dinny soul . [Old Benjy]349-benjy in that dim corner cleared [his]349-benjy throat again . [She]219-dinny started , and , trembling a little , went over to [him]349-benjy . Go and look at [her]219-dinny , [Benjy]349-benjy ; [she]219-dinny s asleep . [She]219-dinny put [her]219-dinny hand under [his]349-benjy elbow to help the action of [his]349-benjy stiffened knees . At [his]349-benjy full height [he]349-benjy was only up to [her]219-dinny shoulder , a little dried - up pippin of [a man]632-a man . [She]219-dinny kept at [his]349-benjy side , moving across [the room]1076-the room . Together [they]1987-they looked down at the forehead and cheeks , slowly uncreasing in the queer beauty of death . [The little old husband]1946-the little old husband s face went crimson and puffy , like that of [a child who had lost its doll]1989-a child who had lost its doll ; [he]1946-the little old husband said in a sort of angered squeak : Eh ! [She]219-dinny m not asleep . [She]219-dinny m gone . [She]219-dinny won t never speak agen . Look ! [She]219-dinny an t [Mother]231-mother no more ! Where s [that nurse]1990-that nurse ? [She]219-dinny didn ought to ave left [er]1991-er H ssh ! [Benjy]349-benjy ! But [she]219-dinny m dead . What ll [I]0-i do ? [He]1946-the little old husband turned [his]1946-the little old husband withered apple face up to [Dinny]219-dinny , and there came from [him]1946-the little old husband an unwashed odour , as of grief and snuff and old potatoes . Can t stop [ere]1992-ere , [he]1946-the little old husband said , with [Mother]231-mother like that . Tain t [nateral]350-nateral . No ; go [downstairs]1092-downstairs and smoke [your]349-benjy pipe , and tell [nurse]734-nurse when [she]734-nurse comes . Tell [er]1991-er ; [I]0-i ll tell er shoulden never ave left [er]1991-er . Oh , [dear]664-dear ! Oh , dear ! Oh , dear ! Putting [her]219-dinny hand on [his]1946-the little old husband shoulders , [Dinny]219-dinny guided [him]1946-the little old husband to [the stairway]1996-the stairway , and watched [him]1946-the little old husband stumbling and groping and grieving [his]1946-the little old husband way down . Then [she]219-dinny went back to the bed . The smoothed - out face had an uncanny attraction for [her]219-dinny . With every minute that passed it seemed the more to proclaim superiority . Almost triumphant it was , as [she]219-dinny gazed , in its slow , sweet relaxation after age and pain ; character revealed in the mould of that brief interval between torturing life and corrupting death . Good as gold ! Those were the words [they]1997-they should grave on the humble stone [they]1997-they would put over [her]219-dinny . Wherever [she]219-dinny was now , or whether , indeed , [she]219-dinny was anywhere , did not matter . [She]219-dinny had done [her]219-dinny bit . [Betty]247-liz ! [She]219-dinny was still standing there gazing when [the nurse]738-the nurse came back . Chapter 16

Since [[her]219-dinny husband]1428-her husband s departure [Clare]302-clare had met [young Croom]287-tony constantly , but always at the stipulated arm s - length . [Love]351-love had made [him]287-tony unsociable , and to be conspicuously in [his]287-tony company was unwise , so [she]302-clare did not make [him]287-tony known to [[her]302-clare friends]2000-her friends ; [they]2000-her friends met where [they]2000-her friends could eat cheaply , see films , or simply walk . To [[her]302-clare rooms]1312-her rooms [she]302-clare had not invited [him]287-tony again , nor had [he]287-tony asked to come . [His]287-tony behaviour , indeed , was exemplary , except when [he]287-tony fell into tense and painful silences , or gazed at [her]302-clare till [her]302-clare hands itched to shake [him]287-tony . [He]287-tony seemed to have paid several visits to [Jack Muskham]272-jack muskham [s stud farm]2002-s stud farm , and to be spending hours over books which debated whether the excellence of [Eclipse]352-eclipse was due to [the Lister Turk]2003-the lister turk , rather than to [the Darley Arabian]2004-the darley arabian , and whether it were preferable to breed - in to Blacklock with [St. Simon on Speculum]353-st. simon on speculum or with Speculum on [St. Simon]91-st. simon . When [she]302-clare returned from [Condaford]10-condaford after the New Year , [she]302-clare had not heard from [him]287-tony for five consecutive days , so that [he]287-tony was bulking more largely in [her]302-clare thoughts . [DEAR TONY]214-tony , [she]302-clare wrote to [him]287-tony at [the Coffee House]506-the coffee house : Where and how are [you]287-tony ? [I]0-i am back . Very happy New Year ! [Yours]287-tony always , [CLARE]302-clare . The answer did not come for three days , during which [she]302-clare felt at first huffy , then anxious , and finally a little scared . It was indited from [the inn at [Bablock Hythe]72-bablock hythe]2006-the inn at bablock hythe : [DARLING CLARE]302-clare [I]0-i was ever so relieved to get [your]302-clare note , because [I]0-i d determined not to write until [I]0-i heard from [you]302-clare . Nothing s further from [my]0-i thoughts than to bore [you]302-clare with [myself]0-i , and sometimes [I]0-i don t know whether [I]0-i am or not . So far as [a person]2007-a person can be who is not seeing [you]302-clare , [I]0-i m all right ; [I]0-i m overlooking the fitting up of the boxes for those mares . [They]2008-they the boxes will be prime . The difficulty is going to be acclimatisation ; it s supposed to be mild here , and [the pasture]2009-the pasture looks as if it would be tip - top . [This part of [the world]787-the world]2010-this part of the world is quite pretty , especially [the river]477-the river . Thank [God]218-god [the inn]2013-the inn s cheap , and [I]0-i can live indefinitely on eggs and bacon . [Jack Muskham]272-jack muskham has been brick enough to start [my]0-i salary from the New Year , so [I]0-i m thinking of laying out [my]0-i remaining sixty - odd pounds on [[Stapylton s]283-stapylton old two - seater]2014-stapylton s old two - seater . [He]283-stapylton s just off back to [India]14-india .
