[I]0-i hope [you]2016-you had a splendid time at [Condaford]10-condaford . Do [you]2016-you know [I]0-i haven t seen [you]2016-you for sixteen days , and am absolutely starving . [I]0-i ll be up on Saturday afternoon . Where can [I]0-i meet [you]2016-you ? [[Your]2016-you ever devoted [TONY]214-tony]2017-your ever devoted tony . [Clare]302-clare read this letter on the sofa in [[her]302-clare room]672-her room , frowning a little as [she]302-clare opened , smiling a little as [she]302-clare finished it . Poor dear [Tony]214-tony ! Grabbing a telegraph form , [she]302-clare wrote : Come to tea [Melton Mews]50-melton mews . C. and despatched it on [her]302-clare way to [the Temple]1412-the temple . The importance attaching to the meeting of [two young people]492-two young people depends on the importance which [others]1498-others attach to [their]1498-others not meeting . [Tony Croom]287-tony approached [Melton Mews]50-melton mews without thinking of [anyone]918-anyone but [Clare]302-clare , and failed to observe [a shortish man in horn - rimmed spectacles , black boots]2023-a shortish man in horn - rimmed spectacles , black boots , and a claret - coloured tie , who looked like [the secretary of a learned society]2024-the secretary of a learned society . Unobtrusive and unobserved , [this individual]2025-this individual had already travelled with [him]287-tony from [Bablock Hythe]72-bablock hythe to [Paddington]93-paddington , from [Paddington]93-paddington to [the Coffee House]506-the coffee house , from [the Coffee House]506-the coffee house to [the corner of [Melton Mews]50-melton mews]2028-the corner of melton mews ; had watched [him]287-tony enter [No . 2]1206-no . 2 , made an entry in a pocket - book , and with an evening paper in [his]2025-this individual hand was now waiting for [him]287-tony to come out again . With touching fidelity [he]287-tony read no news , keeping [his]287-tony prominent glance on that peacock - blue door , prepared at any moment to close [himself]287-tony like an umbrella and vanish into [the street - scape]2030-the street - scape . And while [he]287-tony waited which was [his]287-tony normal occupation [he]287-tony thought , like [other citizens]2031-other citizens , of the price of living , of the cup of tea which [he]287-tony would like , of [[his]287-tony small daughter]2032-his small daughter and [her]2032-his small daughter collection of foreign stamps , and of whether [he]287-tony would now have to pay income tax . [His]287-tony imagination dwelled , also , on the curves of [a young woman at [the tobacconist s]2034-the tobacconist s where [he]287-tony obtained [his]287-tony gaspers]2033-a young woman at the tobacconist s where he obtained his gaspers . [His]287-tony name was [Chayne]354-mr. chayne , and [he]287-tony made [his]287-tony living out of a remarkable memory for faces , inexhaustible patience , careful entries in [his]287-tony pocket - book , the faculty of self - obliteration , and that fortunate resemblance to [the secretaries of [learned societies]2036-learned societies]2035-the secretaries of learned societies . [He]287-tony was , indeed , employed by the Polteed Agency , who made [their]2037-their living by knowing more than was good for [those about whom [they]2037-their knew it]2038-those about whom they knew it . Having received [his]287-tony instruction on the day [Clare]302-clare returned to [London]25-london , [he]287-tony had already been five days on the job , and [no one]533-no one knew it except [[his]287-tony employer]2040-his employer and [himself]287-tony . Spying on [other people]641-other people being , according to the books [he]287-tony read , [the chief occupation of [the people of [these islands]2044-these islands]2043-the people of these islands]2042-the chief occupation of the people of these islands , it had never occurred to [him]287-tony to look down on a profession conscientiously pursued for seventeen years . [He]287-tony took a pride in [his]287-tony work , and knew [himself]287-tony for [a capable sleuth]2045-a capable sleuth . Though somewhat increasingly troubled in the bronchial regions owing to the draughts [he]287-tony had so often to stand in , [he]287-tony could not by now imagine any other way of passing [his]287-tony time , or any , on the whole , more knowing method of gaining a livelihood . [Young Croom]287-tony s address [he]287-tony had obtained by the simple expedient of waiting behind [Clare]302-clare while [she]302-clare sent [her]302-clare telegram ; but , having just failed to read the message itself , [he]287-tony had started at once for [Bablock Hythe]72-bablock hythe , since when until now [he]287-tony had experienced no difficulty . Shifting [his]287-tony position from time to time at the end of [the street]1131-the street , [he]287-tony entered [the Mews]81-the mews [itself]81-the mews when it became dark . At half - past five the peacock door was opened and [the two young people]2047-the two young people emerged . [They]2047-the two young people walked , and [Mr. Chayne]354-mr. chayne walked behind [them]2047-the two young people . [They]2047-the two young people walked fast , and [Mr. Chayne]354-mr. chayne , with an acquired sense of rhythm , at exactly the same pace . [He]354-mr. chayne soon perceived that [they]2047-the two young people were merely going to where [he]354-mr. chayne had twice followed [Lady Corven]269-lady corven already [the Temple]42-the temple . And this gave [him]354-mr. chayne a sense of comfort , because of the cup of tea [he]354-mr. chayne pined for . [He]354-mr. chayne had just finished the bun when [he]354-mr. chayne regained the entrance to [the Lane]1937-the lane . [The young man]518-the young man was still parading slowly . Sure of [them]2058-their now for a couple of hours , [he]354-mr. chayne settled down to smoke , feel warm , and enjoy the film . [They]2058-their looked so settled - in that [he]354-mr. chayne took the opportunity to slip out for a moment . It might not occur again for a long time . In [his]354-mr. chayne opinion one of the chief defects in detective stories for [he]354-mr. chayne was given to [busmen]2067-busmen s holidays was that [authors]2068-authors made [their]2068-authors sleuths like unto [the angels]2069-the angels , watching for days without , so to speak , taking [their]2068-authors eye off the ball . It was not so in real life . [He]354-mr. chayne returned to a seat almost behind [[his]354-mr. chayne young couple]2070-his young couple on the other side just before the lights went down . One of [his]354-mr. chayne favourite stars was now to be featured , and , sure that [she]2066-the young lady at his tobacconist would be placed in situations which would enable [him]354-mr. chayne to enjoy [her]2066-the young lady at his tobacconist to the full , [he]354-mr. chayne put a peppermint lozenge in [his]354-mr. chayne mouth and leaned back with a sigh . [He]354-mr. chayne had not had an evening watch so pleasant for a long time . It was not always beer and skittles at this season of the year ; a proper chilly job sometimes no error . Descending to the lavatory , [Mr. Chayne]354-mr. chayne changed [his]354-mr. chayne horn spectacles to pince - nez and [his]354-mr. chayne claret - coloured tie to a rather floppy bow of black and white . This was a device which had often served [him]354-mr. chayne in good stead . [You]2081-you put on a tie of conspicuous colour , then changed it to a quieter one of a different shape . A conspicuous tie had the special faculty of distracting attention from a face . [You]2081-you became [that man with the awful tie]2082-that man with the awful tie ! and when [you]2081-you no longer wore the tie , [you]2081-you were to all intents [someone else]1280-someone else . Going up again to a table which commanded a view , [he]354-mr. chayne ordered [himself]354-mr. chayne a mixed grill and pint of stout . They were warm and glowing ; large landscapes with blue skies , seas , palms , and villas , suggestive of pleasure in a way that appealed to [him]354-mr. chayne strongly . [He]354-mr. chayne had never been further than [Boulogne]96-boulogne , and , so far as [he]354-mr. chayne could see , never would . Five hundred pounds , [a lady]2086-a lady , a suite in the sun , and gaming tables handy , was not unnaturally [his]354-mr. chayne idea of [heaven]2087-heaven ; but , alas , as unattainable . [He]354-mr. chayne made no song about it , but , when confronted with allurements like these on the wall , [he]354-mr. chayne could not help hankering . It had often struck [him]354-mr. chayne as ironical that [the people [he]354-mr. chayne watched]2088-the people he watched into [the Divorce Court]2089-the divorce court so often went to [Paradise]97-paradise and stayed [there]605-there until [their]2088-the people he watched cases had blown over and [they]2088-the people he watched could marry and come to [earth]2091-earth again . Living in [Finchley]98-finchley , with the sun once a fortnight and an income averaging perhaps five hundred a year , the vein of poetry in [him]354-mr. chayne was damned almost at source ; and it was in some sort a relief to let [his]354-mr. chayne imagination play around the lives of [those whom [he]354-mr. chayne watched]2092-those whom he watched . [That young couple over there]2093-that young couple over there , [good - lookers both of [them]2093-that young couple over there]2094-good - lookers both of them , would go back together in [a taxi]1427-a taxi as likely as not [he]354-mr. chayne d have to wait hours for [the young man]518-the young man to come away . The mixed grill was put before [him]354-mr. chayne , and [he]354-mr. chayne added a little red pepper in view of [his]354-mr. chayne probable future . This bit of watching , however , and perhaps another one or two , ought to do the trick ; and on the whole easy money . The traffic was but thin at this hour before [the theatres]2113-the theatres rose , and the procession simplicity itself . [The followed cab]2114-the followed cab stopped at [the corner of [the Mews]81-the mews]1435-the corner of the mews . [Mr. Chayne]354-mr. chayne tapped the glass and fell back on the seat . [Mr. Chayne]354-mr. chayne also paid and followed to the corner . [They]2116-they had reached the peacock door and stood there , talking . Then [Lady Corven]269-lady corven put [her]269-lady corven key into the lock and opened the door ; [the young man , glancing this way and that]2119-the young man , glancing this way and that , followed [her]269-lady corven in . [Mr. Chayne]354-mr. chayne experienced a sensation as mixed as [his]354-mr. chayne grill . It was , of course , exactly what [he]354-mr. chayne had hoped for and expected . At the same time it meant loitering about in the cold for goodness knew how long . [He]354-mr. chayne turned up [his]354-mr. chayne coat collar and looked for a convenient doorway . A thousand pities that [he]354-mr. chayne could not wait , say half an hour , and just walk in . [The Courts]99-the courts were very particular nowadays about conclusive evidence . [He]354-mr. chayne had something of the feeling that [a sportsman]2120-a sportsman has , seeing a fox go to ground and not a spade within five miles . [He]354-mr. chayne stood for a few minutes , reading over the entries in [his]354-mr. chayne pocket - book under the lamp , and making a final note ; then walked to the doorway [he]354-mr. chayne had selected and stood there . In half an hour or so [the cars]2121-the cars would be coming back from [the theatre]2122-the theatre , and [he]354-mr. chayne would have to be on the move to escape attention . There was a light in the upstairs window , but in itself , of course , that was not evidence . Too bad ! Twelve shillings the return ticket , ten and six the night down there , cabs seven and six ; cinema three and six , dinner six bob [he]354-mr. chayne wouldn t charge the tea thirty - nine and six say two pounds ! [Mr. Chayne]354-mr. chayne shook [his]354-mr. chayne head , put a peppermint lozenge in [his]354-mr. chayne mouth , and changed [his]354-mr. chayne feet . That corn of [his]354-mr. chayne was beginning to shoot a bit . [He]354-mr. chayne thought of pleasant things : [Broadstairs]356-broadstairs , [his]354-mr. chayne small daughter s back hair , oyster patties , [his]354-mr. chayne favourite star in little but a corset belt , and [his]354-mr. chayne own nightcap of hot whisky and lemon . All to small purpose ; for [he]354-mr. chayne was waiting and waiting on feet that ached , and without any confidence that [he]354-mr. chayne was collecting anything of real value . [The Courts]99-the courts , indeed , had got into such a habit of expecting the parties to be called with a cup of tea that anything short of it was looked upon as suspect . [He]354-mr. chayne took out [his]354-mr. chayne watch again . [He]354-mr. chayne had been [here]866-here over half an hour . And here came [the first car]2124-the first car ! The third of February was a day so bland and of such spring - like texture that the quickened blood demanded adventure . This was why [Tony Croom]287-tony sent an early wire and set out at noon from [Bablock Hythe]72-bablock hythe in [his]287-tony [old but newly - acquired two - seater]2234-old but newly - acquired two - seater . [The car]532-the car was not [his]287-tony dream , but it could do fifty at the pinch [he]287-tony liked to give it . [He]287-tony took [the nearest bridge]2236-the nearest bridge , ran for [Abingdon]108-abingdon , and on past [Benson]109-benson to [Henley]110-henley . There [he]287-tony stopped to snatch a sandwich and fill up , and again on [the bridge]2237-the bridge for a glimpse at [the sunlit river softly naked below the bare woods]2238-the sunlit river softly naked below the bare woods . From there on [he]287-tony travelled by [the dock]535-the dock , timing [himself]287-tony to reach [Melton Mews]50-melton mews at two o clock . [Clare]302-clare was not ready , having only just come in . [He]287-tony sat in [the downstairs room]2240-the downstairs room , now furnished with three chairs , a small table , of quaint design , cheap owing to the slump in antiques , and an amethyst - coloured chased decanter containing sloe gin . [Everyone]617-everyone snores on occasion . This will be it . [They]2379-they talked for a little . But all seemed unreal , except just being beside [her]2360-her in the dark . [He]287-tony could hear now and again [a car]828-a car passing ; other noises of the night there were none ; too dark even for the owls . [His]287-tony pipe went out , and [he]287-tony put it away . Oh ! [He]287-tony was in for a sleepless night , with this faint perfume from [her]2360-her egging on [his]287-tony senses and the warmth of [her]2360-her arm tingling into [his]287-tony . Even if this were all , it would be sheer waste to sleep . [Her]2360-her head snuggled down on to [his]287-tony scarf ; and the faint perfume , which carried with it reminder of a sunny pine wood , increased . Was it credible that [she]2360-her was there against [his]287-tony shoulder , and would be for another six or seven hours ? And [he]287-tony shuddered . So still and matter - of - fact ! No sign in [her]2360-her of passion or disturbance ; [he]287-tony might have been [[her]2360-her brother]1270-her brother . With the force of revelation [he]287-tony perceived that this night would be a test that [he]287-tony must pass ; for if [he]287-tony did not [she]2360-her would recoil and drop away from [him]287-tony . [She]2360-her WAS asleep . Oh ! yes . [You]2382-you couldn t counterfeit that little regular cluck , as of the tiniest chicken a perfect little sound , faintly comic , infinitely precious ! Whatever happened to [him]287-tony now , [he]287-tony would have passed a night with [her]2360-her ! [He]287-tony sat still as a mouse , if mice are still . [Her]2360-her head grew heavier and more confiding with the deepening of [her]2360-her slumber . And , while [he]287-tony sat and listened , [his]287-tony feeling for [her]2360-her deepened too , became almost a passion of protection and of service . And the night , cold , dark , still [no cars]2383-no cars were passing now kept [him]287-tony company ; like [some huge , dark , enveloping , just breathing creature]2384-some huge , dark , enveloping , just breathing creature , it was awake . The night did not sleep ! For the first time in [his]287-tony life [he]287-tony realised that . Night was wakeful as the day . Unlighted and withdrawn , it had its sentience neither spoke nor moved , just watched , and breathed . With stars and moon , or , as to - night , lampless and shuttered , it was a great companion . [His]287-tony arm grew stiff , and , as if that reached [her]2360-her consciousness , [she]2360-her withdrew [her]2360-her head but did not wake . [He]287-tony rubbed [his]287-tony shoulder just in time , for almost at once [her]2360-her head lolled back again . Screwing round till [his]287-tony lips just touched [her]2360-her hair , [he]287-tony heard again , chicklike and bland , that faint rhythmic cluck . It ceased and became the deeper breathing of far - down slumber . Then drowsiness crept on [him]287-tony too ; [he]287-tony slept . Chapter 19

[Young Croom]268-young croom awoke , stiff and unconscious of where [he]287-tony was . A voice said : It s just getting light , [Tony]287-tony , but [I]0-i can t see to read the hymn . [His]287-tony voice , far away , even from [himself]287-tony , answered : And so it s over . Was it so terrible ? [He]287-tony put [his]287-tony hands to [his]287-tony head , and did not answer . The thought that next night and all the nights to come [he]287-tony would be apart from [her]2360-her again was like a blow over the heart . [She]2360-her opened the door . [I]0-i m going to stamp [my]0-i feet a bit . Then [we]2386-we might have a stroll to warm [ourselves]2386-we . [We]2386-we shan t get breakfast anywhere till eight . [He]287-tony started the engine to warm [the car]532-the car . Light was creeping into the wood ; [he]287-tony could see the beech - tree against whose trunk [they]2386-we had passed the night . Then [he]287-tony , too , got out and walked towards [the road]956-the road . Still grey - dark and misty , the wood on either side of [its]2389-its dim open streak looked mournful and mysterious . No wind , no sound ! [He]287-tony felt as [Adam]393-adam might have felt , dragging towards [the Park Gates of [Eden]37-eden]2390-the park gates of eden without having earned the right to be expelled . [Adam]393-adam ! [Clare]302-clare lay in a very hot bath . It was of the geyser type and not long enough , but it provided a good soak . [She]302-clare felt as when , [a little girl]739-a little girl , [she]302-clare had done something unpleasing to [[her]302-clare governess]2412-her governess , without discovery . But poor dear [Tony]287-tony ! A pity [men]959-men were so impatient . [They]959-men had as little liking for cool philandering as for shopping . [They]959-men rushed into [shops]2414-shops , said : Have [you]2415-you such and such ? No ? and rushed out again . [They]959-men hated trying on , being patted here and there , turning [their]959-men heads to look at [their]959-men back views . To savour what was fitting was to [them]959-men anathema . [Tony]287-tony was [a child]1239-a child . [She]302-clare felt [herself]302-clare much older by nature and experience . Though much in request before [her]302-clare marriage , [Clare]302-clare had never come into close contact with [those who , centred in [London]25-london and [themselves]2417-those who , centred in london and themselves]2417-those who , centred in london and themselves , were devoid of belief in anything but mockery , motion and enough money to have from day to day a good time . Transplanted to [Ceylon]6-ceylon , [she]302-clare had kept [her]302-clare tastes , and spent [her]302-clare time in the saddle or on the tennis ground . Reading many novels , [she]302-clare professed , indeed , to keep abreast of the current , with all its impatience of restraint ; but , lying in [her]302-clare bath , [she]302-clare was uneasy . It had not been fair to put [Tony]287-tony to such strain as that of last night . The closer [she]302-clare allowed [him]287-tony to come to [her]302-clare , short of the contacts of love , the more [she]302-clare would be torturing [him]287-tony . And what doing about [her]302-clare ? And three weeks passed , during which [Clare]302-clare saw [young Croom]287-tony but four times in all . Kiss [my]0-i hand that doesn t count . [He]0-i kissed it , muttered : God bless [you]302-clare ! and , grabbing [his]0-i hat , went out . [Clare]302-clare turned a chair to the unwinking warmth of the electric fire , and sat brooding . The dry heat burned [her]302-clare eyes till they felt as if they had no lids and no capacity for moisture ; slowly and definitely [she]302-clare grew angrier . All the feelings [she]302-clare had experienced , before [she]302-clare made up [her]302-clare mind that morning in [Ceylon]6-ceylon to cut adrift , came back to [her]302-clare with redoubled fury . How dared [he]0-i treat [her]302-clare as if [she]302-clare had been a light of love ? worse than if [she]302-clare had been [one a light of love]2541-one a light of love would never have stood it . How dared [he]0-i touch [her]302-clare with that whip ? And now how dared [he]0-i have [her]302-clare watched , and bring this case ? [She]302-clare would not lie down under this ! [She]302-clare began methodically to wash up and put the things away . [She]302-clare opened the door wide and let the wind come in . In spite of [her]2699-her always active life at [Condaford]10-condaford [Dinny]302-clare often felt there , as [one]604-one does waking in the still hours of the night , nervous from the very quietude ; and in such troubles as [Hubert]238-hubert s , three years before , [her]2699-her own crisis of two years ago , or this of [Clare]302-clare s , [she]2699-her craved at once to be more in the swim of life . Having dropped [Clare]302-clare at [[her]302-clare Mews]2701-her mews , [she]2699-her went on in [the taxi]1432-the taxi , and arrived at [Mount Street]43-mount street before dinner . [Michael]227-michael and [Fleur]221-fleur were [there]605-there , and the conversation turned and turned from literature to politics . [Michael]227-michael was of opinion that the papers were beginning to pat [the country]573-the country s back too soon , and that [the Government]128-the government might go to sleep . [She]302-clare reached [Mount Street]43-mount street at last and let [herself]302-clare in . And there a sudden horror of betraying that anything had happened to awaken pity for [her]302-clare , interest in [her]302-clare , any sort of feeling , beset [her]302-clare , and [she]302-clare fled to [[her]302-clare room]672-her room . What was it to [[anyone]918-anyone but [her]302-clare]2869-anyone but her ? And pride so moved within [her]302-clare that even [her]302-clare heart felt cold as stone . Chapter 24

But [she]302-clare WAS ill , and for a month in [[her]302-clare conventual room at [Condaford]10-condaford]2879-her conventual room at condaford often wished [she]302-clare were dead and done with . [She]302-clare might , indeed , quite easily have died if such belief as [she]302-clare had in a future life had grown instead of declining as [her]302-clare strength ebbed . To rejoin [Wilfrid]237-wilfrid , where [this world]1621-this world s pain and judgments were not , had a fatal attraction . To fade out into the sleep of nothingness was not hard , but had no active enticement ; and , as the tide of health turned back within [her]302-clare , seemed less and less natural . The solicitude of [people]574-people had a subtle , pervasive healing influence . [The village]559-the village required a daily bulletin , [[her]302-clare mother]658-her mother had been writing or phoning almost daily to [a dozen people]2884-a dozen people . On March the thirtieth , spring visited [[her]302-clare room]672-her room with southwest airs , a small bowl of the first spring flowers , some pussy willows and a sprig of gorse . [She]302-clare was picking up rapidly now , and three days later was out of doors . For everything in nature [she]302-clare felt a zest such as [she]302-clare had not known for a long time . Yet [she]302-clare had no desire to do anything or see [anybody]512-anybody . [She]5-england rewrapped the ribbon , photograph , and letter and thrust them into [her]5-england bag . Making no noise , [she]5-england opened the door , went down [the stairs]1062-the stairs , and out into the sunshine . Alone by [the river]477-the river , [she]5-england unfolded the sheet [she]5-england had taken from the letter , and , under a plane tree as yet bare of leaves , read these verses : Lie Still ! The sun , who brings [all earth]2989-all earth to bloom , Corrupts and makes corruption flower , Is just a flame that thro the gloom Of heaven burns a little hour ; And , figured on the chart of night A somewhat negligible star Is but a pinpricked point of light As [million - million others are]2990-million - million others are ; And , though it be the all in all Of [my]0-i existence and decay , It has as simple rise and fall As [I]0-i have , and as short a day . But that no unction to [my]0-i heart Will lay ; the smallest germ in [me]0-i Plays just as passionate a part As [I]0-i do , in eternity . The germ and [I]0-i and sun , [we]2991-we rise , Fulfil [our]2991-we little lives , and die ; And to all question [God]218-god replies : Lie still ! [I]0-i can not tell [you]2992-you why ! Lie still ! [The Embankment]1743-the embankment was nearly empty of [people]574-people and of traffic . [She]5-england walked on , crossing the main lines of the traffic , and came to [Kensington Gardens]147-kensington gardens . So one ran through life , watching [each venture]3007-each venture coming to [shore]586-shore , and at the end lay still ! Like birds who uttered [their]3009-their songs , hunted for worms , preened [their]3009-their feathers , flew without seeming cause , unless for joy ; mated , built nests and fed [[their]3009-their young]3010-their young , and when all was over became little stiffened bundles of feathers , and passed into corruption , and dust . [I]0-i was thinking more of [children]1983-children . [She]5-england walked into what in old days would have been called a glade . Chapter 27

With that promise to [her]3102-she credit [she]3102-she went back to [Condaford]10-condaford the following day and gave [herself]3102-she to mitigation of the atmosphere [she]3102-she found there . [[Her]3102-she father]942-her father and [mother]657-mother , living [their]3106-their ordinary lives , were obviously haunted and harassed . [[Her]3102-she mother]658-her mother , sensitive and secluded , was just shrinking from publicity discreditable to [Clare]302-clare . [[Her]3102-she father]942-her father seemed to feel that , however the case went , [most people]1401-most people would think [[his]942-her father daughter]1184-his daughter [a light women]3111-a light women and [a liar]3112-a liar ; [young Croom]220-dinny would be excused more or less , but [a woman who allowed circumstance to take such turns]3113-a woman who allowed circumstance to take such turns would find [no one]533-no one to excuse [her]3113-a woman who allowed circumstance to take such turns . [He]942-her father was clearly feeling , too , a vindictive anger against [Jerry Corven]213-jerry , and a determination that [the fellow]667-the fellow should not be successful if [he]942-her father could help it . Faintly amused at an attitude so male , [Dinny]220-dinny felt a sort of admiration at the painful integrity with which [he]942-her father was grasping the shadow and letting the substance go . To [[her]3102-she father]942-her father s generation divorce still seemed the outward and visible sign of inner and spiritual disgrace . To [herself]3102-she love was love and , when it became aversion , ceased to justify sexual relationship . [She]3102-she had , in fact , been more shocked by [Clare]302-clare s yielding to [Jerry Corven]213-jerry in [[her]3102-she rooms]1312-her rooms than by [her]3102-she leaving [him]213-jerry in [Ceylon]6-ceylon . The divorce suits [she]3102-she had occasionally followed in the papers had done nothing to help [her]3102-she believe that marriages were made in heaven . But [she]3102-she recognised the feelings of those brought up in an older atmosphere , and avoided adding to the confusion and trouble in [[her]3102-she people]1706-her people s minds . The line [she]3102-she took was more practical : The thing would soon be over one way or the other , and probably the other ! Still a common complaint , said [the General]662-the general drily : Did [you]3233-you see [they]3240-they ve more than balanced the Budget ? It s an hysterical age , with these European crises for breakfast every other morning . That s the papers . The French papers , where the print is so much smaller , don t excite one half so much . According to [her]302-clare account , [he]2520-the petitioner was from the beginning of [their]4058-their acquaintanceship in the nature of [a friend to [her]302-clare]4059-a friend to her and nothing more . On the other hand , if [you]4051-you believe [the petitioner]2520-the petitioner on that point and there seems no sufficient reason for [his]2520-the petitioner volunteering perjury it follows that [you]4051-you disbelieve [the respondent]3426-the respondent , and [she]3426-the respondent has deliberately denied evidence which was in [her]3426-the respondent favour rather than against [her]3426-the respondent . It seems difficult to believe that [she]3426-the respondent would do that unless [she]3426-the respondent had feelings for [the co - respondent]3082-the co - respondent warmer than those of mere friendship . This is , in fact , a very crucial point , and the decision [you]4051-you come to as to which is true [the husband]3960-the husband s statement or [the wife]4064-the wife s denial of it seems to [me]0-i a cardinal factor in [your]4051-you consideration of whether or not to accept [the respondent]3426-the respondent s evidence in the rest of the case . [You]4051-you have only what is called circumstantial evidence to go upon ; and in such cases the credibility of [the parties]3424-the parties is a very important factor . If on one point [you]4051-you are satisfied that one of [the parties]3424-the parties is not speaking the truth , then the whole of [his]4068-his or [her]4069-her evidence is tinged with doubt . In regard to [the co - respondent]3082-the co - respondent , though [he]3082-the co - respondent conveyed an impression of candour , [you]4051-you must remember that there is a traditional belief in [this country]1160-this country , regrettable or not , that [a man whose attentions have involved [a married woman in a situation of this kind]4073-a married woman in a situation of this kind]4072-a man whose attentions have involved a married woman in a situation of this kind must not , in vulgar parlance , give [her]4073-a married woman in a situation of this kind away . [You]4051-you must ask [yourselves]4051-you how far [you]4051-you can treat [this young man , who is quite obviously , and by [his]4074-this young man , who is quite obviously , and by his own admission , deeply in love own admission , deeply in love]4074-this young man , who is quite obviously , and by his own admission , deeply in love , as [a free , independent , truthful witness]4075-a free , independent , truthful witness . In these days [young people]3778-young people are free and easy in [their]3778-young people association with [each other]494-each other . What might have seemed conclusive indication in the days of [my]0-i youth is now by no means conclusive . In regard to the night , however , that was spent in [the car]532-the car , [you]4051-you may think it well to pay particular attention to the answer [the respondent]3426-the respondent gave to [my]0-i question : Why , when the lights went out , [they]4081-they did not simply stop [a passing car]4082-a passing car , tell [the occupants]4083-the occupants what had happened , and request to be given a lead into [Henley]110-henley . [Dinny]302-clare s gaze by now had left [the Judge]2781-the judge s face and was fixed upon [the jury]2786-the jury . And , while [she]302-clare searched the lack of expression on those twelve faces , a cardinal factor was uppermost in [her]302-clare mind : It was easier to disbelieve than to believe . The word damages took [her]302-clare eyes back to [the Judge]2781-the judge s face . Because , [he]2781-the judge was saying , if [you]4051-you should come to a decision in favour of [the petitioner]2520-the petitioner , the question of the damages [he]2781-the judge claims will arise . And in regard to that [I]0-i must draw [your]4051-you attention to one or two salient considerations . It can not be said that claims for damages in divorce suits are common in these days , or indeed looked on with any great favour in [this Court]4049-this court . It has become disagreeable to think of [women]1023-women in terms of money . Not much more than a hundred years ago it was actually not unknown though illegal even then for [a man]632-a man to offer [[his]632-a man wife]842-his wife for sale . Such days thank [God]218-god ! are long past . Though damages can still be asked for in [this Court]4049-this court , they must not be what is called vindictive , and [they]4101-they must bear reasonable relation to [the co - respondent]3082-the co - respondent s means . In this case [the petitioner]2520-the petitioner has stated that if any damages are awarded [him]2520-the petitioner , [they]4101-they will be settled on [the respondent]3426-the respondent . That is , [one]604-one may say , the usual practice nowadays where damages are claimed . In regard to [the co - respondent]3082-the co - respondent s , means , if it should become necessary for [you]4051-you to consider the question of damages , [I]0-i would remind [you]4051-you that [[his]2520-the petitioner counsel]3661-his counsel stated that [he]2520-the petitioner has no private means , and offered to provide evidence of the fact . [One]604-one has never known [counsel]3908-counsel to make a statement of that sort without being sure of [his]2520-the petitioner ground , and [I]0-i think [you]4051-you may take [the co - respondent]3082-the co - respondent s word for it that [his]2520-the petitioner only means of subsistence are derived from [his]2520-the petitioner er job , which appears to carry a salary of four hundred pounds a year . Those , then , are the considerations which should guide [you]4051-you if [you]4051-you should have to consider the amount , if any , of damages to be awarded . More deadly than the atmosphere during a fight is that when it is over . [You]302-clare keep on thinking of better answers , and [you]302-clare feel that life is not worth living . [Tony Croom]287-tony had spent a miserable week in [[his]287-tony converted cottages at [Bablock Hythe]72-bablock hythe]4232-his converted cottages at bablock hythe . The evidence given by [Corven]213-jerry on [his]287-tony recall to the box had seared [him]287-tony , nor had [Clare]302-clare s denial anointed the burn . In [this young man]2578-this young man was an old - fashioned capacity for jealousy . That [a wife]610-a wife should accept [[her]610-a wife husband]1428-her husband s embrace was not , of course , unknown ; but , in the special circumstances and states of feeling , it had seemed to [him]287-tony improper , if not monstrous , and the giving of [his]287-tony own evidence , directly after such a thrust at [his]287-tony vitals , had but inflamed the wound . A sad unreason governs sex ; to be aware that [he]287-tony had no right to be suffering brought no relief . And now , a week after the trial , receiving [her]302-clare note of invitation , [he]287-tony had the impulse not to answer , to answer and upbraid , to answer like [a gentleman]817-a gentleman and , all the time , [he]287-tony knew [he]287-tony would just go up . There was the novel [he]0-i had been trying to read , tipped on to the floor ; the remains of [his]0-i cheese and fruit lunch not cleared away ; a pair of brown shoes which [he]0-i had been going to shine up . Almost at once [he]0-i fell asleep , and awoke in daylight . [He]0-i woke remembering that [he]0-i had meant to spend the night in action . Level sunlight was slanting in at the window . Rabbits and bees and birds nothing else as yet awake . [He]0-i lay on [his]0-i back staring at the grass and the bushes and the early sky , blue and lightly fleeced . Perhaps because [he]0-i could see so little from that hollow all [England]5-england seemed to be with [him]0-i . A wild bee close to [his]0-i hand was digging into a flower , there was a faint scent , as of daisy - chains ; but chiefly it was the quality of the grass its close freshness , its true greenness . Greatness and dignity and peace ! That play ! Those words had given [him]0-i a choke . [Other people]641-other people had laughed , [Clare]302-clare had laughed . Sentimental ! [she]302-clare had said . [No country]4287-no country ever had , or will have Greatness and dignity and peace . Let [people]574-people laugh [you]4291-you couldn t ! Leave grass like this ! [He]0-i remembered the thrill [he]0-i had felt six months ago , seeing again English grass ! [He]458-adrian walked slowly , thinking of the balance - sheet that confronts [each lover]4326-each lover s unlimited liability . No waterings of capital nor any insurance could square or guarantee that shifting lifelong document . By love was [man]1577-man flung into [the world]787-the world ; with love was [he]1577-man in business nearly all [his]1577-man days , making debts or profit ; and when [he]1577-man died was by the results of love , if not by [the parish]4329-the parish , buried and forgotten . All [his]458-adrian other activities [man]1577-man could insure , modify , foresee , provide against save the inconvenient activity of death ; love [he]458-adrian could not . [It]4335-it stepped to [him]458-adrian out of the night , into the night returned . [It]4335-it stayed , it fled . It mocked [dictators]4336-dictators , [parliaments]4337-parliaments , [judges]1391-judges , [bishops]1388-bishops , [police]4340-police , and even good intentions ; it maddened with joy and grief ; wantoned , procreated , thieved , and murdered ; was devoted , faithful , fickle . [It]4335-it had no shame , and owned [no master]4341-no master ; built [homes]4342-homes and gutted [them]4342-homes ; passed by on the other side ; and now and again made of two hearts one heart till death . [She]302-clare felt , as sometimes when [a little girl]739-a little girl , that [she]302-clare must roam about , explore the strangeness of the dead of night , sit on the stairs , peep into [rooms]2287-rooms , curl up in some armchair . [She]302-clare made [her]302-clare way to one of the French windows , drew the curtains back , and opened it . [She]302-clare stood there a minute taking deep breaths . Very dark , very still , very warm . By starlight [she]302-clare could just see the sheen on the magnolia leaves . Leaving the window open , [she]302-clare sought [her]302-clare favourite old armchair , and curled up in it with [her]302-clare feet tucked under [her]302-clare . There , hugging [herself]302-clare , [she]302-clare tried to recapture the feeling that [she]302-clare was [a child]1239-a child again . The night air came in , the clock ticked , and the hot feeling in [her]302-clare veins seemed to cool away in measure with its rhythm . [She]302-clare shut [her]302-clare eyes fast , and the sort of cosiness [she]302-clare used to feel in that old chair , as if [she]302-clare were all clasped and protected , stole upon [her]302-clare ; but still [she]302-clare did not sleep . Behind [her]302-clare from the window with the rising of the moon a presence had stolen in , a sort of fingering uncanny light , slowly lifting each familiar object into ghostly semblance of itself . It was as if [the room]1076-the room had come awake to keep [her]302-clare company ; and the feeling [she]302-clare had sometimes had , that [the old house]1889-the old house had a life of its own , felt , saw , knew its spells of wakefulness and of slumber , tingled once more within [her]302-clare . [Adrian]458-adrian sat writing to [[his]458-adrian wife]842-his wife . [Condaford]10-condaford : August 10 . [MY]0-i VERY DEAR [I]0-i promised to give [you]842-his wife a true and particular account of how [Dinny]302-clare went off . Look in The Lantern for [their]4541-their conception of [the bride]4542-the bride and [bridegroom]4543-bridegroom leaving [the church]1633-the church . [Dornford]278-dornford looked quite good value in this style , fourteen - and - six ; and [Dinny]302-clare bless [her]302-clare ! without [the bride]4542-the bride s smile , almost as if [she]4542-the bride saw the joke . Ever since the engagement , [I]0-i ve wondered what [she]4542-the bride s really feeling . Love such as [she]4542-the bride gave [Desert]4546-desert it certainly is not , but [I]0-i don t believe there s any physical reluctance . When , yesterday , [I]0-i said to [her]4542-the bride : In good heart ? [her]4542-the bride answer was : No half heart , anyway . [[We]4547-we both of [us]4547-we]4548-we both of us have reason to know that [she]4542-the bride can go all out in what [she]4542-the bride does for [other people]641-other people . But [she]4542-the bride s really doing this for [herself]4542-the bride . [She]4542-the bride ll be carrying on [she]4542-the bride ll have [children]1983-children and [she]4542-the bride ll count . Besides , [he]278-dornford knows from [me]0-i , if not from [her]4542-the bride , what [she]4542-the bride s capable of , and won t expect more until [he]278-dornford gets it . [The congregation]4555-the congregation was perhaps a trifle Early English , though it seemed to [me]0-i [you]4553-you could have got most of the faces at [Woolworth s.]207-woolworth s. Even [Con]441-con and [Liz]247-liz , who have to stick down here all the time , haven t got quite the hang of it . Remarkable , if [you]4553-you think , that there is such a thing as [County]208-county left ; but [I]0-i suppose it ll last while there s huntin and shootin . But there s a real difference in [the young men]2182-the young men and [maidens]4580-maidens . [The girls]4581-the girls have most excellent legs and stockings and quite tasteful dresses ; and [the youths]4582-the youths good flannel suits and collars and ties all done by [the motor bike]4583-the motor bike and the film . Really , that chickenpox was very perverse ; [you]4586-you and [[your]4586-you two]4590-your two were terribly missed , and [Ronald]297-ronald as a page would just have topped everything up . [I]0-i walked back to [the Grange]24-the grange with [Lawrence]463-lawrence and [Em]236-aunt em , an imposing steel - grey presence slightly marred where tears had got mixed with [her]236-aunt em powder sometimes . [Lawrence]463-lawrence , [I]0-i m old . [Whereon Lawrence]476-whereon lawrence took [her]236-aunt em hand , and [they]4594-they walked hand in hand the rest of the way . The reception was held on [the terrace]754-the terrace and [lawn]4596-lawn ; [everybody]788-everybody came , [schoolchildren]4598-schoolchildren and all , a quaint mix - up , but jolly , it seemed to [me]0-i . [I]0-i didn t know [I]0-i was so fond of [the old place]4599-the old place . However much one may believe in levelling - up chances , there s something about [old places]4600-old places . They can t be re - created if [they]4600-old places re once let slip , and [they]4600-old places focus landscape in a queer kind of way . [Some villages]4601-some villages and [landscapes]4602-landscapes seem to have no core [you]4603-you can t explain why , but they feel hollow , and shallow and flat . [A real old place]4604-a real old place puts heart into [a neighbourhood]4605-a neighbourhood . If [the people who live in]4606-the people who live in [it]4604-a real old place are not just [selfish pigs]4607-selfish pigs , it means a lot in a quiet way to [people who have no actual ownership in it]4608-people who have no actual ownership in it . [The Grange]647-the grange is a sort of anchor to [this neighbourhood]4610-this neighbourhood . [I]0-i doubt if [you]4603-you d find [a single villager , however poor , who grudged [its]4604-a real old place existence , or wouldn t feel the worse for its ruination]4611-a single villager , however poor , who grudged its existence , or wouldn t feel the worse for its ruination . Generations of love and trouble , and goodness knows not too much money , have been spent on it , and the result is something very hand - made and special . Everything s changing , and has got to change , no doubt , and how to save the old that s worth saving , whether in landscape , [houses]2340-houses , manners , institutions , or human types , is one of [our]4613-our greatest problems , and the one that [we]4613-our bother least about . [We]4613-our save [our]4613-our works of art , [our]4613-our old furniture , [we]4613-our have [our]4613-our cult and a strong one of antiques , and not even the most go - ahead modern thought objects to that . Why not the same throughout [our]4613-our social life ? The old order changeth yes , but [we]4613-our ought to be able to preserve beauty and dignity , and the sense of service , and manners things that have come very slowly , and can be made to vanish very fast if [we]4613-our aren t set on preserving them somehow . Human nature being what it is , nothing seems to [me]0-i more futile than to level to the ground and start again . The old order had many excrescences , and was by no means all [werry]4613-our capital , but , now that [the housebreakers]4614-the housebreakers are in , [one]604-one does see that [you]4603-you can smash in an hour what has taken centuries to produce ; and that , unless [you]4603-you can see [your]4603-you way pretty clearly to replace what admittedly wasn t perfect with something more perfect , [you]4603-you re throwing human life back instead of advancing it . The thing is to pick on what s worth preserving , though [I]0-i don t say there s very much that is . Well , that s all very portentous ! To come back to [Dinny]219-dinny [they]4616-they re going to spend [their]4616-they honeymoon in [Shropshire]160-shropshire , [round about where [Dornford]235-dornford comes from]4617-round about where dornford comes from . Then [they]4616-they come back here for a bit , then settle in on [Campden Hill]158-campden hill . [I]0-i hope this weather will last for [them]4616-they . Honeymooning in wet weather , especially when [one]604-one is keener on the other than the other is on the one , should be very trying . [Dinny]302-clare s going away frock , [you]4603-you may like to know , was blue , and suited [her]302-clare not quite down to the ground . [We]4619-we had a minute together . [I]0-i gave [her]302-clare [your]4603-you love , and [she]302-clare sent [you]4603-you hers , and said : Well , [I]0-i m very nearly over , [[Uncle]4620-uncle dear]4221-uncle dear . Wish [me]0-i luck ! [I]0-i felt like piping [my]0-i eye . Over what ? Well , anyway , if wishes for luck will help , [she]302-clare goes wreathed with [them]4616-they ; but all that kissing business is hard to get through . [Con]441-con and [Liz]247-liz took [theirs]4616-they down at [the car]532-the car . [I]0-i felt rather [a brute]1100-a brute , looking at [their]4616-they faces when [she]302-clare d gone . [They]4616-they went away in [[Dornford]278-dornford s car]4624-dornford s car , with [himself]278-dornford driving . After that [I]0-i confess that [I]0-i slunk off . [They]4616-they re all right , [I]0-i know , but it didn t feel like it . There s such cursed finality about a wedding , however easy divorce is or may become ; besides , [Dinny]302-clare is not the sort who would take [someone who loved [her]302-clare and then let [him]4625-someone who loved her and then let him down down]4625-someone who loved her and then let him down ; it s the old - fashioned for better for worse there , but [I]0-i think it ll be for better in the long run , anyway . [I]0-i sneaked out of sight into [the orchard]675-the orchard and then up through [the fields]676-the fields to [the woods]3156-the woods . [I]0-i hope it was as gorgeous a day with [you]4629-you as it was here . [These beech - woods on [the slopes]4631-the slopes]4630-these beech - woods on the slopes are more beautiful than the careful beech - clumps they plant on downs , though even those have a sort of temple - like effect , in spite of being meant as landmarks or to give shade to sheep . [I]0-i can assure [you]4629-you that wood about half - past five was enchanted . [I]0-i went up [the slope]4632-the slope and sat down and just enjoyed it . Great shifting shafts of sunlight coming in below and splashing the trunks ; and ever - so - green cool spaces between only one word for it , holy . The trees , many of [them]4630-these beech - woods on the slopes , go up branchless for a long way , and some of the trunks looked almost white . Not much undergrowth and very little life except jays and a brown squirrel . When [you]4629-you re in [a wood]4633-a wood as lovely as that , and think of death duties and timber , [your]4629-you heart turns over and over as if [you]4629-you d supped entirely off Spanish onions . Two hundred years in [His]4625-someone who loved her and then let him down sight may be as yesterday , but in [mine]0-i [I]0-i confess they re like eternity . [These woods]4634-these woods are no longer shot , and [anybody]512-anybody can come into [them]4634-these woods . [I]0-i suppose [the young folk]4636-the young folk do what a place to wander about in , lovering ! [I]0-i lay down in a patch of sunlight and thought of [you]4629-you ; and two small grey wood - doves perched about fifty yards off and talked cosily to each other , so that [I]0-i could have done with [my]0-i field - glasses . Willow - herb and tansy were out where trees have come down and been cleared away foxgloves don t seem to flourish round here . It was very restful , except that one ached a bit because it was green and beautiful . Queer , that beauty ache ! Lurking consciousness of mortality , perhaps knowledge that all things must slip away from one in time , and the greater [their]4634-these woods beauty the greater the loss in store ! Mistake in [our]4637-our make - up , that . [We]4637-our ought to feel : The greater the earth s beauty , the more marvellous the screen of light and wind and foliage , the lovelier nature , in fact the deeper and sweeter [our]4637-our rest in [her]4638-her will be . All very puzzling ! [I]0-i know the sight of a dead rabbit out in a wood like that affects [me]0-i more than it does in [a poulterer s shop]4639-a poulterer s shop . [I]0-i passed one as [I]0-i was going back killed by [a weasel]4640-a weasel ; its soft limpness seemed saying : Pity [I]0-i m dead ! Death may be a good thing , but life s a better . A dead shape that s still a shape moves one horribly . Shape IS life , and when life s gone one can t see why shape should remain even for the little time it does . [I]0-i d have liked to stay and see the moon come up and peer about in there , and slowly fill it all up with ghostly glistening ; then [I]0-i might have caught the feeling that shape lives on in rarefied form , and all of [us]4637-our , even the dead rabbits and birds and moths , still move and have [their]4634-these woods being which may be the truth , for all [I]0-i know or ever shall . But dinner was at eight , so [I]0-i had to come away with the light still green and golden there flows alliteration again like [a twopenny brook]4641-a twopenny brook ! Outside , on [the terrace]754-the terrace , [I]0-i met [[Dinny]302-clare s spaniel]4643-dinny s spaniel , [Foch]240-foch . Knowing [his]4643-dinny s spaniel history , it was like meeting [a banshee]4644-a banshee not that [he]4643-dinny s spaniel was howling ; but it reminded [me]0-i sharply of what [Dinny]302-clare has been through . [He]4643-dinny s spaniel was sitting on [his]4643-dinny s spaniel haunches and looking down at nothing , as [dogs especially spaniels]4645-dogs especially spaniels will when things are beyond them , and the one and only scent is no more , for the time being . [He]4643-dinny s spaniel ll go with [them]4645-dogs especially spaniels , of course , to [Campden Hill]158-campden hill when [they]4645-dogs especially spaniels come back . [I]0-i went up and had a bath , and dressed , and stood at [my]0-i window , listening to the drone of [a tractor]4646-a tractor still cutting corn , and getting a little drunk on whiffs from the honeysuckle that climbs and flowers round [my]0-i window . [I]0-i see now what [Dinny]302-clare meant by : Over . [Over [the river]477-the river that [she]302-clare used to dream [she]302-clare couldn t cross]4647-over the river that she used to dream she couldn t cross . Well , all life is crossing [rivers]4649-rivers , or getting drowned on the way . [I]0-i hope [I]0-i believe [she]302-clare s touching [shore]586-shore . Dinner was just like dinner always is [we]4651-our didn t talk of [her]302-clare , or mention [our]4651-our feelings in any way . [I]0-i played Clare a game of billiards [she]302-clare struck [me]0-i as softer and more attractive than [I]0-i ve ever seen [her]302-clare . And then [I]0-i sat up till past midnight with [Con]441-con , in order , apparently , that [we]4651-our might say nothing . [They]4652-they ll miss [her]302-clare a lot , [I]0-i m afraid . The silence in [[my]0-i room]1641-my room , when [I]0-i got up [here]866-here at last , was stunning , and the moonlight almost yellow . The moon s hiding , now , behind one of the elms , and the evening star shining above a dead branch . A few other stars are out , but very dim . It s a night far from [our]4651-our time , far even from [[our]4651-our world]4655-our world . Not an owl hooting , but the honeysuckle still sweet . And so , [[my]0-i most dear]4656-my most dear , here endeth the tale ! Good night ! [[Your]4656-my most dear ever loving [ADRIAN]458-adrian]4657-your ever loving adrian .
